18 
20 // Remarks on the implementations
21 //
22 // Variable names: in most functions, variable names have been
23 // standardized in the following way:
24 //
25 // n1, n2, ni Number of points in coordinate direction 1, 2, i
26 // will be 1 if i>=dim
27 //
28 // i1, i2, ii Loop variable running up to ni
29 //
30 // d1, d2, di Multiplicators for ii to find positions in the
31 // array of nodes.
33

64 
65 // we need the following exception from a global function, so can't declare it
66 // in the usual way inside a class
67 namespace
68 {
69  DeclException2 (ExcUnexpectedInput,
70  std::string, std::string,
71  << "Unexpected input: expected line\n <"
72  << arg1
73  << ">\nbut got\n <"
74  << arg2 << ">");
75 }
76 
77 
78 namespace
79 {
80 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB
81  // the functions in this namespace are
82  // taken from the libb64 project, see
83  // http://sourceforge.net/projects/libb64
84  //
85  // libb64 has been placed in the public
86  // domain
87  namespace base64
88  {
89  typedef enum
90  {
91  step_A, step_B, step_C
92  } base64_encodestep;
93 
94  typedef struct
95  {
96  base64_encodestep step;
97  char result;
98  } base64_encodestate;
99 
100  void base64_init_encodestate(base64_encodestate *state_in)
101  {
102  state_in->step = step_A;
103  state_in->result = 0;
104  }
105 
106  inline
107  char base64_encode_value(char value_in)
108  {
109  static const char *encoding
110  = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/";
111  if (value_in > 63) return '=';
112  return encoding[(int)value_in];
113  }
114 
115  int base64_encode_block(const char *plaintext_in,
116  int length_in,
117  char *code_out,
118  base64_encodestate *state_in)
119  {
120  const char *plainchar = plaintext_in;
121  const char *const plaintextend = plaintext_in + length_in;
122  char *codechar = code_out;
123  char result;
124 
125  result = state_in->result;
126 
127  switch (state_in->step)
128  {
129  while (1)
130  {
131  DEAL_II_FALLTHROUGH;
132  case step_A:
133  {
134  if (plainchar == plaintextend)
135  {
136  state_in->result = result;
137  state_in->step = step_A;
138  return codechar - code_out;
139  }
140  const char fragment = *plainchar++;
141  result = (fragment & 0x0fc) >> 2;
142  *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(result);
143  result = (fragment & 0x003) << 4;
144  DEAL_II_FALLTHROUGH;
145  }
146  case step_B:
147  {
148  if (plainchar == plaintextend)
149  {
150  state_in->result = result;
151  state_in->step = step_B;
152  return codechar - code_out;
153  }
154  const char fragment = *plainchar++;
155  result |= (fragment & 0x0f0) >> 4;
156  *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(result);
157  result = (fragment & 0x00f) << 2;
158  DEAL_II_FALLTHROUGH;
159  }
160  case step_C:
161  {
162  if (plainchar == plaintextend)
163  {
164  state_in->result = result;
165  state_in->step = step_C;
166  return codechar - code_out;
167  }
168  const char fragment = *plainchar++;
169  result |= (fragment & 0x0c0) >> 6;
170  *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(result);
171  result = (fragment & 0x03f) >> 0;
172  *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(result);
173  }
174  }
175  }
176  /* control should not reach here */
177  return codechar - code_out;
178  }
179 
180  int base64_encode_blockend(char *code_out, base64_encodestate *state_in)
181  {
182  char *codechar = code_out;
183 
184  switch (state_in->step)
185  {
186  case step_B:
187  *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(state_in->result);
188  *codechar++ = '=';
189  *codechar++ = '=';
190  break;
191  case step_C:
192  *codechar++ = base64_encode_value(state_in->result);
193  *codechar++ = '=';
194  break;
195  case step_A:
196  break;
197  }
198  *codechar++ = '\0';
199 
200  return codechar - code_out;
201  }
202  }
203 
204 
213  char *
214  encode_block (const char *data,
215  const int data_size)
216  {
217  base64::base64_encodestate state;
218  base64::base64_init_encodestate(&state);
219 
220  char *encoded_data = new char[2*data_size+1];
221 
222  const int encoded_length_data
223  = base64::base64_encode_block (data, data_size,
224  encoded_data, &state);
225  base64::base64_encode_blockend (encoded_data + encoded_length_data,
226  &state);
227 
228  return encoded_data;
229  }
230 
231 
236  int get_zlib_compression_level(const DataOutBase::VtkFlags::ZlibCompressionLevel level)
237  {
238  switch (level)
239  {
240  case (DataOutBase::VtkFlags::no_compression):
241  return Z_NO_COMPRESSION;
242  case (DataOutBase::VtkFlags::best_speed):
243  return Z_BEST_SPEED;
244  case (DataOutBase::VtkFlags::best_compression):
245  return Z_BEST_COMPRESSION;
246  case (DataOutBase::VtkFlags::default_compression):
247  return Z_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION;
248  default:
249  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
250  return Z_NO_COMPRESSION;
251  }
252  }
253 
260  template <typename T>
261  void write_compressed_block (const std::vector<T> &data,
262  const DataOutBase::VtkFlags &flags,
263  std::ostream &output_stream)
264  {
265  if (data.size() != 0)
266  {
267  // allocate a buffer for compressing
268  // data and do so
269  uLongf compressed_data_length
270  = compressBound (data.size() * sizeof(T));
271  char *compressed_data = new char[compressed_data_length];
272  int err = compress2 ((Bytef *) compressed_data,
273  &compressed_data_length,
274  (const Bytef *) &data[0],
275  data.size() * sizeof(T),
276  get_zlib_compression_level(flags.compression_level));
277  (void)err;
278  Assert (err == Z_OK, ExcInternalError());
279 
280  // now encode the compression header
281  const uint32_t compression_header[4]
282  = { 1, /* number of blocks */
283  (uint32_t)(data.size() * sizeof(T)), /* size of block */
284  (uint32_t)(data.size() * sizeof(T)), /* size of last block */
285  (uint32_t)compressed_data_length
286  }; /* list of compressed sizes of blocks */
287 
288  char *encoded_header = encode_block ((char *)&compression_header[0],
289  4 * sizeof(compression_header[0]));
290  output_stream << encoded_header;
291  delete[] encoded_header;
292 
293  // next do the compressed
294  // data encoding in base64
295  char *encoded_data = encode_block (compressed_data,
296  compressed_data_length);
297  delete[] compressed_data;
298 
299  output_stream << encoded_data;
300  delete[] encoded_data;
301  }
302  }
303 #endif
304 }
305 
306 
307 // some declarations of functions and locally used classes
308 namespace DataOutBase
309 {
310  namespace
311  {
318  class SvgCell
319  {
320  public:
321 
322  // Center of the cell (three-dimensional)
323  Point<3> center;
324 
328  Point<3> vertices[4];
329 
334  float depth;
335 
339  Point<2> projected_vertices[4];
340 
341  // Center of the cell (projected, two-dimensional)
342  Point<2> projected_center;
343 
347  bool operator < (const SvgCell &) const;
348  };
349 
350  bool SvgCell::operator < (const SvgCell &e) const
351  {
352  // note the "wrong" order in
353  // which we sort the elements
354  return depth > e.depth;
355  }
356 
357 
358 
365  class EpsCell2d
366  {
367  public:
368 
372  Point<2> vertices[4];
373 
378  float color_value;
379 
384  float depth;
385 
389  bool operator < (const EpsCell2d &) const;
390  };
391 
392 
403  template <int dim, int spacedim>
404  void
405  write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
406  Table<2,double> &data_vectors)
407  {
408  // unlike in the main function, we
409  // don't have here the data_names
410  // field, so we initialize it with
411  // the number of data sets in the
412  // first patch. the equivalence of
413  // these two definitions is checked
414  // in the main function.
415 
416  // we have to take care, however, whether the
417  // points are appended to the end of the
418  // patch->data table
419  const unsigned int n_data_sets
420  =patches[0].points_are_available ? (patches[0].data.n_rows() - spacedim) : patches[0].data.n_rows();
421 
422  Assert (data_vectors.size()[0] == n_data_sets,
423  ExcInternalError());
424 
425  // loop over all patches
426  unsigned int next_value = 0;
427  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch=patches.begin();
428  patch != patches.end(); ++patch)
429  {
430  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
431  (void)n_subdivisions;
432 
433  Assert ((patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets && !patch->points_are_available) ||
434  (patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets+spacedim && patch->points_are_available),
435  ExcDimensionMismatch (patch->points_are_available
436  ?
437  (n_data_sets + spacedim)
438  :
439  n_data_sets,
440  patch->data.n_rows()));
441  Assert ((n_data_sets == 0)
442  ||
443  (patch->data.n_cols() == Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n_subdivisions+1)),
444  ExcInvalidDatasetSize (patch->data.n_cols(), n_subdivisions+1));
445 
446  for (unsigned int i=0; i<patch->data.n_cols(); ++i, ++next_value)
447  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
448  data_vectors[data_set][next_value] = patch->data(data_set,i);
449  }
450 
451  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
452  Assert (data_vectors[data_set].size() == next_value,
453  ExcInternalError());
454  }
455  }
456 }
457 
458 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
459 // DataOutFilter class member functions
460 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
461 
462 template<int dim>
463 void DataOutBase::DataOutFilter::write_point(const unsigned int &index, const Point<dim> &p)
464 {
465  Map3DPoint::const_iterator it;
466  unsigned int internal_ind;
467  Point<3> int_pt;
468 
469  for (int d=0; d<3; ++d) int_pt(d) = (d < dim ? p(d) : 0);
470  node_dim = dim;
471  it = existing_points.find(int_pt);
472 
473  // If the point isn't in the set, or we're not filtering duplicate points, add it
474  if (it == existing_points.end() || !flags.filter_duplicate_vertices)
475  {
476  internal_ind = existing_points.size();
477  existing_points.insert(std::make_pair(int_pt, internal_ind));
478  }
479  else
480  {
481  internal_ind = it->second;
482  }
483  // Now add the index to the list of filtered points
484  filtered_points[index] = internal_ind;
485 }
486 
487 void DataOutBase::DataOutFilter::internal_add_cell(const unsigned int &cell_index, const unsigned int &pt_index)
488 {
489  filtered_cells[cell_index] = filtered_points[pt_index];
490 }
491 
492 void DataOutBase::DataOutFilter::fill_node_data(std::vector<double> &node_data) const
493 {
494  Map3DPoint::const_iterator it;
495 
496  node_data.resize(existing_points.size()*node_dim);
497 
498  for (it=existing_points.begin(); it!=existing_points.end(); ++it)
499  {
500  for (unsigned int d=0; d<node_dim; ++d)
501  node_data[node_dim*it->second+d] = it->first(d);
502  }
503 }
504 
505 void DataOutBase::DataOutFilter::fill_cell_data(const unsigned int &local_node_offset, std::vector<unsigned int> &cell_data) const
506 {
507  std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int>::const_iterator it;
508 
509  cell_data.resize(filtered_cells.size());
510 
511  for (it=filtered_cells.begin(); it!=filtered_cells.end(); ++it)
512  {
513  cell_data[it->first] = it->second+local_node_offset;
514  }
515 }
516 
517 template<int dim>
518 void
519 DataOutBase::DataOutFilter::write_cell(
520  unsigned int index,
521  unsigned int start,
522  unsigned int d1,
523  unsigned int d2,
524  unsigned int d3)
525 {
526  unsigned int base_entry = index * GeometryInfo<dim>::vertices_per_cell;
527  vertices_per_cell = GeometryInfo<dim>::vertices_per_cell;
528  internal_add_cell(base_entry+0, start);
529  internal_add_cell(base_entry+1, start+d1);
530  if (dim>=2)
531  {
532  internal_add_cell(base_entry+2, start+d2+d1);
533  internal_add_cell(base_entry+3, start+d2);
534  if (dim>=3)
535  {
536  internal_add_cell(base_entry+4, start+d3);
537  internal_add_cell(base_entry+5, start+d3+d1);
538  internal_add_cell(base_entry+6, start+d3+d2+d1);
539  internal_add_cell(base_entry+7, start+d3+d2);
540  }
541  }
542 }
543 
544 void DataOutBase::DataOutFilter::write_data_set(const std::string &name, const unsigned int &dimension, const unsigned int &set_num, const Table<2,double> &data_vectors)
545 {
546  unsigned int num_verts = existing_points.size();
547  unsigned int i, r, d, new_dim;
548 
549  // HDF5/XDMF output only supports 1D or 3D output, so force rearrangement if needed
550  if (flags.xdmf_hdf5_output && dimension != 1) new_dim = 3;
551  else new_dim = dimension;
552 
553  // Record the data set name, dimension, and allocate space for it
554  data_set_names.push_back(name);
555  data_set_dims.push_back(new_dim);
556  data_sets.emplace_back(new_dim*num_verts);
557 
558  // TODO: averaging, min/max, etc for merged vertices
559  for (i=0; i<filtered_points.size(); ++i)
560  {
561  for (d=0; d<new_dim; ++d)
562  {
563  r = filtered_points[i];
564  if (d < dimension) data_sets.back()[r*new_dim+d] = data_vectors(set_num+d, i);
565  else data_sets.back()[r*new_dim+d] = 0;
566  }
567  }
568 }
569 
570 
571 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
572 //Auxiliary data
573 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
574 
575 namespace
576 {
577  const char *gmv_cell_type[4] =
578  {
579  "", "line 2", "quad 4", "hex 8"
580  };
581 
582  const char *ucd_cell_type[4] =
583  {
584  "", "line", "quad", "hex"
585  };
586 
587  const char *tecplot_cell_type[4] =
588  {
589  "", "lineseg", "quadrilateral", "brick"
590  };
591 
592 #ifdef DEAL_II_HAVE_TECPLOT
593  const unsigned int tecplot_binary_cell_type[4] =
594  {
595  0, 0, 1, 3
596  };
597 #endif
598 
599  // NOTE: The dimension of the array is chosen to 5 to allow the choice
600  // DataOutBase<deal_II_dimension,deal_II_dimension+1> in general
601  // Wolfgang supposed that we don't need it in general, but however this
602  // choice avoids a -Warray-bounds check warning
603  const unsigned int vtk_cell_type[5] =
604  {
605  0, 3, 9, 12, static_cast<unsigned int>(-1)
606  };
607 
608 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
609 //Auxiliary functions
610 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
611 //For a given patch, compute the node interpolating the corner nodes
612 //linearly at the point (xstep, ystep, zstep)*1./n_subdivisions.
613 //If the points are saved in the patch->data member, return the
614 //saved point instead
615 
616 //TODO: Make this function return its value, rather than using a reference
617 // as first argument; take a reference for 'patch', not a pointer
618  template <int dim, int spacedim>
619  inline
620  void
621  compute_node(
622  Point<spacedim> &node,
623  const DataOutBase::Patch<dim,spacedim> *patch,
624  const unsigned int xstep,
625  const unsigned int ystep,
626  const unsigned int zstep,
627  const unsigned int n_subdivisions)
628  {
629  if (patch->points_are_available)
630  {
631  unsigned int point_no=0;
632  switch (dim)
633  {
634  case 3:
635  Assert (zstep<n_subdivisions+1, ExcIndexRange(zstep,0,n_subdivisions+1));
636  point_no+=(n_subdivisions+1)*(n_subdivisions+1)*zstep;
637  DEAL_II_FALLTHROUGH;
638  case 2:
639  Assert (ystep<n_subdivisions+1, ExcIndexRange(ystep,0,n_subdivisions+1));
640  point_no+=(n_subdivisions+1)*ystep;
641  DEAL_II_FALLTHROUGH;
642  case 1:
643  Assert (xstep<n_subdivisions+1, ExcIndexRange(xstep,0,n_subdivisions+1));
644  point_no+=xstep;
645 
646  // break here for dim<=3
647  break;
648 
649  default:
650  Assert (false, ExcNotImplemented());
651  }
652  for (unsigned int d=0; d<spacedim; ++d)
653  node[d]=patch->data(patch->data.size(0)-spacedim+d,point_no);
654  }
655  else
656  {
657  // perform a dim-linear interpolation
658  const double stepsize=1./n_subdivisions,
659  xfrac=xstep*stepsize;
660 
661  node = (patch->vertices[1] * xfrac) + (patch->vertices[0] * (1-xfrac));
662  if (dim>1)
663  {
664  const double yfrac=ystep*stepsize;
665  node*= 1-yfrac;
666  node += ((patch->vertices[3] * xfrac) + (patch->vertices[2] * (1-xfrac))) * yfrac;
667  if (dim>2)
668  {
669  const double zfrac=zstep*stepsize;
670  node *= (1-zfrac);
671  node += (((patch->vertices[5] * xfrac) + (patch->vertices[4] * (1-xfrac)))
672  * (1-yfrac) +
673  ((patch->vertices[7] * xfrac) + (patch->vertices[6] * (1-xfrac)))
674  * yfrac) * zfrac;
675  }
676  }
677  }
678  }
679 
680 
681 
682  template<int dim, int spacedim>
683  static
684  void
685  compute_sizes(const std::vector<DataOutBase::Patch<dim, spacedim> > &patches,
686  unsigned int &n_nodes,
687  unsigned int &n_cells)
688  {
689  n_nodes = 0;
690  n_cells = 0;
691  for (typename std::vector<DataOutBase::Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch=patches.begin();
692  patch!=patches.end(); ++patch)
693  {
694  n_nodes += Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(patch->n_subdivisions+1);
695  n_cells += Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(patch->n_subdivisions);
696  }
697  }
698 
704  template<typename FlagsType>
705  class StreamBase
706  {
707  public:
708  /*
709  * Constructor. Stores a reference to the output stream for immediate use.
710  */
711  StreamBase (std::ostream &stream,
712  const FlagsType &flags)
713  :
714  selected_component (numbers::invalid_unsigned_int),
715  stream (stream),
716  flags (flags)
717  {}
718 
723  template <int dim>
724  void write_point (const unsigned int,
725  const Point<dim> &)
726  {
727  Assert (false, ExcMessage ("The derived class you are using needs to "
728  "reimplement this function if you want to call "
729  "it."));
730  }
731 
737  void flush_points () {}
738 
744  template <int dim>
745  void write_cell (const unsigned int /*index*/,
746  const unsigned int /*start*/,
747  const unsigned int /*x_offset*/,
748  const unsigned int /*y_offset*/,
749  const unsigned int /*z_offset*/)
750  {
751  Assert (false, ExcMessage ("The derived class you are using needs to "
752  "reimplement this function if you want to call "
753  "it."));
754  }
755 
762  void flush_cells () {}
763 
768  template <typename T>
769  std::ostream &operator<< (const T &t)
770  {
771  stream << t;
772  return stream;
773  }
774 
781  unsigned int selected_component;
782 
783  protected:
788  std::ostream &stream;
789 
793  const FlagsType flags;
794  };

811

823  void write_cell (const unsigned int index,
824  const unsigned int start,
825  const unsigned int x_offset,
826  const unsigned int y_offset,
827  const unsigned int z_offset);
828

840  void write_dataset (const unsigned int index,
841  const std::vector<data> &values);
842  };

877 
884  class TecplotStream : public StreamBase<DataOutBase::TecplotFlags>
885  {
886  public:
887  TecplotStream (std::ostream &stream,
888  const DataOutBase::TecplotFlags &flags);
889 
890  template <int dim>
891  void write_point (const unsigned int index,
892  const Point<dim> &);
893 
904  template <int dim>
905  void write_cell (const unsigned int index,
906  const unsigned int start,
907  const unsigned int x_offset,
908  const unsigned int y_offset,
909  const unsigned int z_offset);
910  };
911 
918  class UcdStream : public StreamBase<DataOutBase::UcdFlags>
919  {
920  public:
921  UcdStream (std::ostream &stream,
922  const DataOutBase::UcdFlags &flags);
923 
924  template <int dim>
925  void write_point (const unsigned int index,
926  const Point<dim> &);
927 
942  template <int dim>
943  void write_cell (const unsigned int index,
944  const unsigned int start,
945  const unsigned int x_offset,
946  const unsigned int y_offset,
947  const unsigned int z_offset);
948 
959  template<typename data>
960  void write_dataset (const unsigned int index,
961  const std::vector<data> &values);
962  };
963 
970  class VtkStream : public StreamBase<DataOutBase::VtkFlags>
971  {
972  public:
973  VtkStream (std::ostream &stream,
974  const DataOutBase::VtkFlags &flags);
975 
976  template <int dim>
977  void write_point (const unsigned int index,
978  const Point<dim> &);
979 
990  template <int dim>
991  void write_cell (const unsigned int index,
992  const unsigned int start,
993  const unsigned int x_offset,
994  const unsigned int y_offset,
995  const unsigned int z_offset);
996  };
997 
998 
999  class VtuStream : public StreamBase<DataOutBase::VtkFlags>
1000  {
1001  public:
1002  VtuStream (std::ostream &stream,
1003  const DataOutBase::VtkFlags &flags);
1004 
1005  template <int dim>
1006  void write_point (const unsigned int index,
1007  const Point<dim> &);
1008 
1009  void flush_points ();
1010 
1021  template <int dim>
1022  void write_cell (const unsigned int index,
1023  const unsigned int start,
1024  const unsigned int x_offset,
1025  const unsigned int y_offset,
1026  const unsigned int z_offset);
1027 
1028  void flush_cells ();
1029 
1030  template <typename T>
1031  std::ostream &operator<< (const T &);
1032 
1044  template <typename T>
1045  std::ostream &operator<< (const std::vector<T> &);
1046 
1047  private:
1060  std::vector<double> vertices;
1061  std::vector<int32_t> cells;
1062  };
1063 
1064 
1065 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
1066 
1067  DXStream::DXStream (std::ostream &out,
1068  const DataOutBase::DXFlags &f)
1069  :
1070  StreamBase<DataOutBase::DXFlags> (out, f)
1071  {}
1072 
1073 
1074  template<int dim>
1075  void
1076  DXStream::write_point (const unsigned int,
1077  const Point<dim> &p)
1078  {
1079  if (flags.coordinates_binary)
1080  {
1081  float data[dim];
1082  for (unsigned int d=0; d<dim; ++d)
1083  data[d] = p(d);
1084  stream.write(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(data),
1085  dim * sizeof(*data));
1086  }
1087  else
1088  {
1089  for (unsigned int d=0; d<dim; ++d)
1090  stream << p(d) << '\t';
1091  stream << '\n';
1092  }
1093  }
1094 
1095 
1096 
1097  template<int dim>
1098  void
1099  DXStream::write_cell (unsigned int,
1100  unsigned int start,
1101  unsigned int d1,
1102  unsigned int d2,
1103  unsigned int d3)
1104  {
1105  int nodes[1<<dim];
1106  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::dx_to_deal[0]] = start;
1107  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::dx_to_deal[1]] = start+d1;
1108  if (dim>=2)
1109  {
1110  // Add shifted line in y direction
1111  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::dx_to_deal[2]] = start+d2;
1112  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::dx_to_deal[3]] = start+d2+d1;
1113  if (dim>=3)
1114  {
1115  // Add shifted quad in z direction
1116  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::dx_to_deal[4]] = start+d3;
1117  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::dx_to_deal[5]] = start+d3+d1;
1118  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::dx_to_deal[6]] = start+d3+d2;
1119  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::dx_to_deal[7]] = start+d3+d2+d1;
1120  }
1121  }
1122 
1123  if (flags.int_binary)
1124  stream.write(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(nodes),
1125  (1<<dim) * sizeof(*nodes));
1126  else
1127  {
1128  const unsigned int final = (1<<dim) - 1;
1129  for (unsigned int i=0; i<final ; ++i)
1130  stream << nodes[i] << '\t';
1131  stream << nodes[final] << '\n';
1132  }
1133  }
1134 
1135 
1136 
1137  template<typename data>
1138  inline
1139  void
1140  DXStream::write_dataset (const unsigned int,
1141  const std::vector<data> &values)
1142  {
1143  if (flags.data_binary)
1144  {
1145  stream.write(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(&values[0]),
1146  values.size()*sizeof(data));
1147  }
1148  else
1149  {
1150  for (unsigned int i=0; i<values.size(); ++i)
1151  stream << '\t' << values[i];
1152  stream << '\n';
1153  }
1154  }
1155 
1156 
1157 
1158 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
1159 
1160  GmvStream::GmvStream (std::ostream &out,
1161  const DataOutBase::GmvFlags &f)
1162  :
1163  StreamBase<DataOutBase::GmvFlags> (out, f)
1164  {}
1165 
1166 
1167  template<int dim>
1168  void
1169  GmvStream::write_point (const unsigned int,
1170  const Point<dim> &p)
1171  {
1172  Assert(selected_component != numbers::invalid_unsigned_int,
1173  ExcNotInitialized());
1174  stream << p(selected_component) << ' ';
1175  }
1176 
1177 
1178 
1179  template<int dim>
1180  void
1181  GmvStream::write_cell (unsigned int,
1182  unsigned int s,
1183  unsigned int d1,
1184  unsigned int d2,
1185  unsigned int d3)
1186  {
1187  // Vertices are numbered starting
1188  // with one.
1189  const unsigned int start=s+1;
1190  stream << gmv_cell_type[dim] << '\n';
1191 
1192  stream << start << '\t'
1193  << start+d1;
1194  if (dim>=2)
1195  {
1196  stream << '\t' << start+d2+d1
1197  << '\t' << start+d2;
1198  if (dim>=3)
1199  {
1200  stream << '\t' << start+d3
1201  << '\t' << start+d3+d1
1202  << '\t' << start+d3+d2+d1
1203  << '\t' << start+d3+d2;
1204  }
1205  }
1206  stream << '\n';
1207  }
1208 
1209 
1210 
1211  TecplotStream::TecplotStream (std::ostream &out,
1212  const DataOutBase::TecplotFlags &f)
1213  :
1214  StreamBase<DataOutBase::TecplotFlags> (out, f)
1215  {}
1216 
1217 
1218  template<int dim>
1219  void
1220  TecplotStream::write_point (const unsigned int,
1221  const Point<dim> &p)
1222  {
1223  Assert(selected_component != numbers::invalid_unsigned_int,
1224  ExcNotInitialized());
1225  stream << p(selected_component) << '\n';
1226  }
1227 
1228 
1229 
1230  template<int dim>
1231  void
1232  TecplotStream::write_cell (unsigned int,
1233  unsigned int s,
1234  unsigned int d1,
1235  unsigned int d2,
1236  unsigned int d3)
1237  {
1238  const unsigned int start = s+1;
1239 
1240  stream << start << '\t'
1241  << start+d1;
1242  if (dim>=2)
1243  {
1244  stream << '\t' << start+d2+d1
1245  << '\t' << start+d2;
1246  if (dim>=3)
1247  {
1248  stream << '\t' << start+d3
1249  << '\t' << start+d3+d1
1250  << '\t' << start+d3+d2+d1
1251  << '\t' << start+d3+d2;
1252  }
1253  }
1254  stream << '\n';
1255  }
1256 
1257 
1258 
1259  UcdStream::UcdStream (std::ostream &out,
1260  const DataOutBase::UcdFlags &f)
1261  :
1262  StreamBase<DataOutBase::UcdFlags> (out, f)
1263  {}
1264 
1265 
1266  template<int dim>
1267  void
1268  UcdStream::write_point (const unsigned int index,
1269  const Point<dim> &p)
1270  {
1271  stream << index+1
1272  << " ";
1273  // write out coordinates
1274  for (unsigned int i=0; i<dim; ++i)
1275  stream << p(i) << ' ';
1276  // fill with zeroes
1277  for (unsigned int i=dim; i<3; ++i)
1278  stream << "0 ";
1279  stream << '\n';
1280  }
1281 
1282 
1283 
1284  template<int dim>
1285  void
1286  UcdStream::write_cell (unsigned int index,
1287  unsigned int start,
1288  unsigned int d1,
1289  unsigned int d2,
1290  unsigned int d3)
1291  {
1292  int nodes[1<<dim];
1293  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::ucd_to_deal[0]] = start;
1294  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::ucd_to_deal[1]] = start+d1;
1295  if (dim>=2)
1296  {
1297  // Add shifted line in y direction
1298  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::ucd_to_deal[2]] = start+d2;
1299  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::ucd_to_deal[3]] = start+d2+d1;
1300  if (dim>=3)
1301  {
1302  // Add shifted quad in z direction
1303  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::ucd_to_deal[4]] = start+d3;
1304  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::ucd_to_deal[5]] = start+d3+d1;
1305  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::ucd_to_deal[6]] = start+d3+d2;
1306  nodes[GeometryInfo<dim>::ucd_to_deal[7]] = start+d3+d2+d1;
1307  }
1308  }
1309 
1310  // Write out all cells and remember
1311  // that all indices must be shifted
1312  // by one.
1313  stream << index+1 << "\t0 " << ucd_cell_type[dim];
1314  const unsigned int final = (1<<dim);
1315  for (unsigned int i=0; i<final ; ++i)
1316  stream << '\t' << nodes[i]+1;
1317  stream << '\n';
1318  }
1319 
1320 
1321 
1322  template<typename data>
1323  inline
1324  void
1325  UcdStream::write_dataset (const unsigned int index,
1326  const std::vector<data> &values)
1327  {
1328  stream << index+1;
1329  for (unsigned int i=0; i<values.size(); ++i)
1330  stream << '\t' << values[i];
1331  stream << '\n';
1332  }
1333 
1334 
1335 
1336 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
1337 
1338  VtkStream::VtkStream (std::ostream &out,
1339  const DataOutBase::VtkFlags &f)
1340  :
1341  StreamBase<DataOutBase::VtkFlags> (out, f)
1342  {}
1343 
1344 
1345  template<int dim>
1346  void
1347  VtkStream::write_point (const unsigned int,
1348  const Point<dim> &p)
1349  {
1350  // write out coordinates
1351  stream << p;
1352  // fill with zeroes
1353  for (unsigned int i=dim; i<3; ++i)
1354  stream << " 0";
1355  stream << '\n';
1356  }
1357 
1358 
1359 
1360  template<int dim>
1361  void
1362  VtkStream::write_cell (unsigned int,
1363  unsigned int start,
1364  unsigned int d1,
1365  unsigned int d2,
1366  unsigned int d3)
1367  {
1368  stream << GeometryInfo<dim>::vertices_per_cell << '\t'
1369  << start << '\t'
1370  << start+d1;
1371  if (dim>=2)
1372  {
1373  stream << '\t' << start+d2+d1
1374  << '\t' << start+d2;
1375  if (dim>=3)
1376  {
1377  stream << '\t' << start+d3
1378  << '\t' << start+d3+d1
1379  << '\t' << start+d3+d2+d1
1380  << '\t' << start+d3+d2;
1381  }
1382  }
1383  stream << '\n';
1384  }
1385 
1386 
1387 
1388  VtuStream::VtuStream (std::ostream &out,
1389  const DataOutBase::VtkFlags &f)
1390  :
1391  StreamBase<DataOutBase::VtkFlags> (out, f)
1392  {}
1393 
1394 
1395  template<int dim>
1396  void
1397  VtuStream::write_point (const unsigned int,
1398  const Point<dim> &p)
1399  {
1400 #if !defined(DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB)
1401  // write out coordinates
1402  stream << p;
1403  // fill with zeroes
1404  for (unsigned int i=dim; i<3; ++i)
1405  stream << " 0";
1406  stream << '\n';
1407 #else
1408  // if we want to compress, then
1409  // first collect all the data in
1410  // an array
1411  for (unsigned int i=0; i<dim; ++i)
1412  vertices.push_back(p[i]);
1413  for (unsigned int i=dim; i<3; ++i)
1414  vertices.push_back(0);
1415 #endif
1416  }
1417 
1418 
1419  void
1420  VtuStream::flush_points ()
1421  {
1422 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB
1423  // compress the data we have in
1424  // memory and write them to the
1425  // stream. then release the data
1426  *this << vertices << '\n';
1427  vertices.clear ();
1428 #endif
1429  }
1430 
1431 
1432  template<int dim>
1433  void
1434  VtuStream::write_cell (unsigned int,
1435  unsigned int start,
1436  unsigned int d1,
1437  unsigned int d2,
1438  unsigned int d3)
1439  {
1440 #if !defined(DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB)
1441  stream << start << '\t'
1442  << start+d1;
1443  if (dim>=2)
1444  {
1445  stream << '\t' << start+d2+d1
1446  << '\t' << start+d2;
1447  if (dim>=3)
1448  {
1449  stream << '\t' << start+d3
1450  << '\t' << start+d3+d1
1451  << '\t' << start+d3+d2+d1
1452  << '\t' << start+d3+d2;
1453  }
1454  }
1455  stream << '\n';
1456 #else
1457  cells.push_back (start);
1458  cells.push_back (start+d1);
1459  if (dim>=2)
1460  {
1461  cells.push_back (start+d2+d1);
1462  cells.push_back (start+d2);
1463  if (dim>=3)
1464  {
1465  cells.push_back (start+d3);
1466  cells.push_back (start+d3+d1);
1467  cells.push_back (start+d3+d2+d1);
1468  cells.push_back (start+d3+d2);
1469  }
1470  }
1471 #endif
1472  }
1473 
1474 
1475 
1476  void
1477  VtuStream::flush_cells ()
1478  {
1479 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB
1480  // compress the data we have in
1481  // memory and write them to the
1482  // stream. then release the data
1483  *this << cells << '\n';
1484  cells.clear ();
1485 #endif
1486  }
1487 
1488 
1489  template <typename T>
1490  std::ostream &
1491  VtuStream::operator<< (const std::vector<T> &data)
1492  {
1493 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB
1494  // compress the data we have in
1495  // memory and write them to the
1496  // stream. then release the data
1497  write_compressed_block (data, flags, stream);
1498 #else
1499  for (unsigned int i=0; i<data.size(); ++i)
1500  stream << data[i] << ' ';
1501 #endif
1502 
1503  return stream;
1504  }
1505 }
1506 
1507 
1508 
1509 namespace DataOutBase
1510 {
1511  template <int dim, int spacedim>
1512  const unsigned int Patch<dim,spacedim>::space_dim;
1513 
1514  const unsigned int Deal_II_IntermediateFlags::format_version = 3;
1515 
1516 
1517 
1518  template <int dim, int spacedim>
1519  const unsigned int Patch<dim,spacedim>::no_neighbor;
1520 
1521 
1522  template <int dim, int spacedim>
1523  Patch<dim,spacedim>::Patch ()
1524  :
1525  patch_index(no_neighbor),
1526  n_subdivisions (1),
1527  points_are_available(false)
1528  // all the other data has a
1529  // constructor of its own, except
1530  // for the "neighbors" field, which
1531  // we set to invalid values.
1532  {
1533  for (unsigned int i=0; i<GeometryInfo<dim>::faces_per_cell; ++i)
1534  neighbors[i] = no_neighbor;
1535 
1536  Assert (dim<=spacedim, ExcIndexRange(dim,0,spacedim));
1537  Assert (spacedim<=3, ExcNotImplemented());
1538  }
1539 
1540 
1541 
1542  template <int dim, int spacedim>
1543  bool
1544  Patch<dim,spacedim>::operator == (const Patch &patch) const
1545  {
1546 //TODO: make tolerance relative
1547  const double epsilon=3e-16;
1548  for (unsigned int i=0; i<GeometryInfo<dim>::vertices_per_cell; ++i)
1549  if (vertices[i].distance(patch.vertices[i]) > epsilon)
1550  return false;
1551 
1552  for (unsigned int i=0; i<GeometryInfo<dim>::faces_per_cell; ++i)
1553  if (neighbors[i] != patch.neighbors[i])
1554  return false;
1555 
1556  if (patch_index != patch.patch_index)
1557  return false;
1558 
1559  if (n_subdivisions != patch.n_subdivisions)
1560  return false;
1561 
1562  if (points_are_available != patch.points_are_available)
1563  return false;
1564 
1565  if (data.n_rows() != patch.data.n_rows())
1566  return false;
1567 
1568  if (data.n_cols() != patch.data.n_cols())
1569  return false;
1570 
1571  for (unsigned int i=0; i<data.n_rows(); ++i)
1572  for (unsigned int j=0; j<data.n_cols(); ++j)
1573  if (data[i][j] != patch.data[i][j])
1574  return false;
1575 
1576  return true;
1577  }
1578 
1579 
1580 
1581  template <int dim, int spacedim>
1582  std::size_t
1583  Patch<dim,spacedim>::memory_consumption () const
1584  {
1585  return (sizeof(vertices) / sizeof(vertices[0]) *
1586  MemoryConsumption::memory_consumption(vertices[0])
1587  +
1588  MemoryConsumption::memory_consumption(n_subdivisions)
1589  +
1590  MemoryConsumption::memory_consumption(data)
1591  +
1592  MemoryConsumption::memory_consumption(points_are_available));
1593  }
1594 
1595 
1596 
1597  template <int dim, int spacedim>
1598  void
1599  Patch<dim,spacedim>::swap (Patch<dim,spacedim> &other_patch)
1600  {
1601  std::swap (vertices, other_patch.vertices);
1602  std::swap (neighbors, other_patch.neighbors);
1603  std::swap (patch_index, other_patch.patch_index);
1604  std::swap (n_subdivisions, other_patch.n_subdivisions);
1605  data.swap (other_patch.data);
1606  std::swap (points_are_available, other_patch.points_are_available);
1607  }
1608 
1609 
1610 
1611  UcdFlags::UcdFlags (const bool write_preamble)
1612  :
1613  write_preamble (write_preamble)
1614  {}
1615 
1616 
1617 
1618  GnuplotFlags::GnuplotFlags ()
1619  {
1620  space_dimension_labels.emplace_back("x");
1621  space_dimension_labels.emplace_back("y");
1622  space_dimension_labels.emplace_back("z");
1623  }
1624 
1625 
1626 
1627  GnuplotFlags::GnuplotFlags (const std::vector<std::string> &labels)
1628  : space_dimension_labels(labels)
1629  {}
1630 
1631 
1632 
1633  std::size_t
1634  GnuplotFlags::memory_consumption () const
1635  {
1636  return MemoryConsumption::memory_consumption(space_dimension_labels);
1637  }
1638 
1639 
1640 
1641  PovrayFlags::PovrayFlags (const bool smooth,
1642  const bool bicubic_patch,
1643  const bool external_data)
1644  :
1645  smooth (smooth),
1646  bicubic_patch(bicubic_patch),
1647  external_data(external_data)
1648  {}
1649 
1650 
1651  DataOutFilterFlags::DataOutFilterFlags (const bool filter_duplicate_vertices,
1652  const bool xdmf_hdf5_output) :
1653  filter_duplicate_vertices(filter_duplicate_vertices),
1654  xdmf_hdf5_output(xdmf_hdf5_output)
1655  {}
1656 
1657 
1658  void DataOutFilterFlags::declare_parameters (ParameterHandler &prm)
1659  {
1660  prm.declare_entry ("Filter duplicate vertices", "false",
1661  Patterns::Bool(),
1662  "Whether to remove duplicate vertex values.");
1663  prm.declare_entry ("XDMF HDF5 output", "false",
1664  Patterns::Bool(),
1665  "Whether the data will be used in an XDMF/HDF5 combination.");
1666  }
1667 
1668 
1669 
1670  void DataOutFilterFlags::parse_parameters (const ParameterHandler &prm)
1671  {
1672  filter_duplicate_vertices = prm.get_bool ("Filter duplicate vertices");
1673  xdmf_hdf5_output = prm.get_bool ("XDMF HDF5 output");
1674  }
1675 
1676 
1677 
1678  DXFlags::DXFlags (const bool write_neighbors,
1679  const bool int_binary,
1680  const bool coordinates_binary,
1681  const bool data_binary)
1682  :
1683  write_neighbors(write_neighbors),
1684  int_binary(int_binary),
1685  coordinates_binary(coordinates_binary),
1686  data_binary(data_binary),
1687  data_double(false)
1688  {}
1689 
1690 
1691  void DXFlags::declare_parameters (ParameterHandler &prm)
1692  {
1693  prm.declare_entry ("Write neighbors", "true",
1694  Patterns::Bool(),
1695  "A boolean field indicating whether neighborship "
1696  "information between cells is to be written to the "
1697  "OpenDX output file");
1698  prm.declare_entry ("Integer format", "ascii",
1699  Patterns::Selection("ascii|32|64"),
1700  "Output format of integer numbers, which is "
1701  "either a text representation (ascii) or binary integer "
1702  "values of 32 or 64 bits length");
1703  prm.declare_entry ("Coordinates format", "ascii",
1704  Patterns::Selection("ascii|32|64"),
1705  "Output format of vertex coordinates, which is "
1706  "either a text representation (ascii) or binary "
1707  "floating point values of 32 or 64 bits length");
1708  prm.declare_entry ("Data format", "ascii",
1709  Patterns::Selection("ascii|32|64"),
1710  "Output format of data values, which is "
1711  "either a text representation (ascii) or binary "
1712  "floating point values of 32 or 64 bits length");
1713  }
1714 
1715 
1716 
1717  void DXFlags::parse_parameters (const ParameterHandler &prm)
1718  {
1719  write_neighbors = prm.get_bool ("Write neighbors");
1720 //TODO:[GK] Read the new parameters
1721  }

1770  Patterns::Bool(),

1773  Patterns::Bool (),

1789 
1790  EpsFlags::EpsFlags (const unsigned int height_vector,
1791  const unsigned int color_vector,
1792  const SizeType size_type,
1793  const unsigned int size,
1794  const double line_width,
1795  const double azimut_angle,
1796  const double turn_angle,
1797  const double z_scaling,
1798  const bool draw_mesh,
1799  const bool draw_cells,
1800  const bool shade_cells,
1801  const ColorFunction color_function)
1802  :
1803  height_vector(height_vector),
1804  color_vector(color_vector),
1805  size_type(size_type),
1806  size(size),
1807  line_width(line_width),
1808  azimut_angle(azimut_angle),
1809  turn_angle(turn_angle),
1810  z_scaling(z_scaling),
1811  draw_mesh(draw_mesh),
1812  draw_cells(draw_cells),
1813  shade_cells(shade_cells),
1814  color_function(color_function)
1815  {}
1816 
1817 
1818 
1819  EpsFlags::RgbValues
1820  EpsFlags::default_color_function (const double x,
1821  const double xmin,
1822  const double xmax)
1823  {
1824  RgbValues rgb_values = { 0,0,0 };
1825 
1826 // A difficult color scale:
1827 // xmin = black (1)
1828 // 3/4*xmin+1/4*xmax = blue (2)
1829 // 1/2*xmin+1/2*xmax = green (3)
1830 // 1/4*xmin+3/4*xmax = red (4)
1831 // xmax = white (5)
1832 // Makes the following color functions:
1833 //
1834 // red green blue
1835 // __
1836 // / /\ / /\ /
1837 // ____/ __/ \/ / \__/
1838 
1839 // { 0 (1) - (3)
1840 // r = { ( 4*x-2*xmin+2*xmax)/(xmax-xmin) (3) - (4)
1841 // { 1 (4) - (5)
1842 //
1843 // { 0 (1) - (2)
1844 // g = { ( 4*x-3*xmin- xmax)/(xmax-xmin) (2) - (3)
1845 // { (-4*x+ xmin+3*xmax)/(xmax-xmin) (3) - (4)
1846 // { ( 4*x- xmin-3*xmax)/(xmax-xmin) (4) - (5)
1847 //
1848 // { ( 4*x-4*xmin )/(xmax-xmin) (1) - (2)
1849 // b = { (-4*x+2*xmin+2*xmax)/(xmax-xmin) (2) - (3)
1850 // { 0 (3) - (4)
1851 // { ( 4*x- xmin-3*xmax)/(xmax-xmin) (4) - (5)
1852 
1853  double sum = xmax+ xmin;
1854  double sum13 = xmin+3*xmax;
1855  double sum22 = 2*xmin+2*xmax;
1856  double sum31 = 3*xmin+ xmax;
1857  double dif = xmax-xmin;
1858  double rezdif = 1.0/dif;
1859 
1860  int where;
1861 
1862  if (x<(sum31)/4)
1863  where = 0;
1864  else if (x<(sum22)/4)
1865  where = 1;
1866  else if (x<(sum13)/4)
1867  where = 2;
1868  else
1869  where = 3;
1870 
1871  if (dif!=0)
1872  {
1873  switch (where)
1874  {
1875  case 0:
1876  rgb_values.red = 0;
1877  rgb_values.green = 0;
1878  rgb_values.blue = (x-xmin)*4.*rezdif;
1879  break;
1880  case 1:
1881  rgb_values.red = 0;
1882  rgb_values.green = (4*x-3*xmin-xmax)*rezdif;
1883  rgb_values.blue = (sum22-4.*x)*rezdif;
1884  break;
1885  case 2:
1886  rgb_values.red = (4*x-2*sum)*rezdif;
1887  rgb_values.green = (xmin+3*xmax-4*x)*rezdif;
1888  rgb_values.blue = 0;
1889  break;
1890  case 3:
1891  rgb_values.red = 1;
1892  rgb_values.green = (4*x-xmin-3*xmax)*rezdif;
1893  rgb_values.blue = (4.*x-sum13)*rezdif;
1894  break;
1895  default:
1896  break;
1897  }
1898  }
1899  else // White
1900  rgb_values.red = rgb_values.green = rgb_values.blue = 1;
1901 
1902  return rgb_values;
1903  }
1904 
1905 
1906 
1907  EpsFlags::RgbValues
1908  EpsFlags::grey_scale_color_function (const double x,
1909  const double xmin,
1910  const double xmax)
1911  {
1912  EpsFlags::RgbValues rgb_values;
1913  rgb_values.red = rgb_values.blue = rgb_values.green
1914  = (x-xmin)/(xmax-xmin);
1915  return rgb_values;
1916  }
1917 
1918 
1919 
1920  EpsFlags::RgbValues
1921  EpsFlags::reverse_grey_scale_color_function (const double x,
1922  const double xmin,
1923  const double xmax)
1924  {
1925  EpsFlags::RgbValues rgb_values;
1926  rgb_values.red = rgb_values.blue = rgb_values.green
1927  = 1-(x-xmin)/(xmax-xmin);
1928  return rgb_values;
1929  }
1930 
1931 
1932 
1933  bool EpsCell2d::operator < (const EpsCell2d &e) const
1934  {
1935  // note the "wrong" order in
1936  // which we sort the elements
1937  return depth > e.depth;
1938  }
1939 
1940 
1941 
1942  void EpsFlags::declare_parameters (ParameterHandler &prm)
1943  {
1944  prm.declare_entry ("Index of vector for height", "0",
1945  Patterns::Integer(),
1946  "Number of the input vector that is to be used to "
1947  "generate height information");
1948  prm.declare_entry ("Index of vector for color", "0",
1949  Patterns::Integer(),
1950  "Number of the input vector that is to be used to "
1951  "generate color information");
1952  prm.declare_entry ("Scale to width or height", "width",
1953  Patterns::Selection ("width|height"),
1954  "Whether width or height should be scaled to match "
1955  "the given size");
1956  prm.declare_entry ("Size (width or height) in eps units", "300",
1957  Patterns::Integer(),
1958  "The size (width or height) to which the eps output "
1959  "file is to be scaled");
1960  prm.declare_entry ("Line widths in eps units", "0.5",
1961  Patterns::Double(),
1962  "The width in which the postscript renderer is to "
1963  "plot lines");
1964  prm.declare_entry ("Azimut angle", "60",
1965  Patterns::Double(0,180),
1966  "Angle of the viewing position against the vertical "
1967  "axis");
1968  prm.declare_entry ("Turn angle", "30",
1969  Patterns::Double(0,360),
1970  "Angle of the viewing direction against the y-axis");
1971  prm.declare_entry ("Scaling for z-axis", "1",
1972  Patterns::Double (),
1973  "Scaling for the z-direction relative to the scaling "
1974  "used in x- and y-directions");
1975  prm.declare_entry ("Draw mesh lines", "true",
1976  Patterns::Bool(),
1977  "Whether the mesh lines, or only the surface should be "
1978  "drawn");
1979  prm.declare_entry ("Fill interior of cells", "true",
1980  Patterns::Bool(),
1981  "Whether only the mesh lines, or also the interior of "
1982  "cells should be plotted. If this flag is false, then "
1983  "one can see through the mesh");
1984  prm.declare_entry ("Color shading of interior of cells", "true",
1985  Patterns::Bool(),
1986  "Whether the interior of cells shall be shaded");
1987  prm.declare_entry ("Color function", "default",
1988  Patterns::Selection ("default|grey scale|reverse grey scale"),
1989  "Name of a color function used to colorize mesh lines "
1990  "and/or cell interiors");
1991  }
1992 
1993 
1994 
1995  void EpsFlags::parse_parameters (const ParameterHandler &prm)
1996  {
1997  height_vector = prm.get_integer ("Index of vector for height");
1998  color_vector = prm.get_integer ("Index of vector for color");
1999  if (prm.get ("Scale to width or height") == "width")
2000  size_type = width;
2001  else
2002  size_type = height;
2003  size = prm.get_integer ("Size (width or height) in eps units");
2004  line_width = prm.get_double ("Line widths in eps units");
2005  azimut_angle = prm.get_double ("Azimut angle");
2006  turn_angle = prm.get_double ("Turn angle");
2007  z_scaling = prm.get_double ("Scaling for z-axis");
2008  draw_mesh = prm.get_bool ("Draw mesh lines");
2009  draw_cells = prm.get_bool ("Fill interior of cells");
2010  shade_cells = prm.get_bool ("Color shading of interior of cells");
2011  if (prm.get("Color function") == "default")
2012  color_function = &default_color_function;
2013  else if (prm.get("Color function") == "grey scale")
2014  color_function = &grey_scale_color_function;
2015  else if (prm.get("Color function") == "reverse grey scale")
2016  color_function = &reverse_grey_scale_color_function;
2017  else
2018  // we shouldn't get here, since
2019  // the parameter object should
2020  // already have checked that the
2021  // given value is valid
2022  Assert (false, ExcInternalError());
2023  }
2024

2027  TecplotFlags::
2028  TecplotFlags (const char *tecplot_binary_file_name,
2029  const char *zone_name,
2030  const double solution_time)
2031  :
2032  tecplot_binary_file_name(tecplot_binary_file_name),
2033  zone_name(zone_name),
2034  solution_time (solution_time)
2035  {}

2038 
2039  std::size_t
2040  TecplotFlags::memory_consumption () const
2041  {
2042  return sizeof(*this)
2043  + MemoryConsumption::memory_consumption(tecplot_binary_file_name)
2044  + MemoryConsumption::memory_consumption(zone_name);
2045  }

2048 
2049  VtkFlags::VtkFlags (const double time,
2050  const unsigned int cycle,
2051  const bool print_date_and_time,
2052  const VtkFlags::ZlibCompressionLevel compression_level)
2053  :

2057  compression_level (compression_level)
2058  {}

2060 
2061 
2062  OutputFormat
2063  parse_output_format (const std::string &format_name)
2064  {
2065  if (format_name == "none")
2066  return none;
2067 
2068  if (format_name == "dx")
2069  return dx;
2070 
2071  if (format_name == "ucd")
2072  return ucd;
2073 
2074  if (format_name == "gnuplot")
2075  return gnuplot;
2076 
2077  if (format_name == "povray")
2078  return povray;
2079 
2080  if (format_name == "eps")
2081  return eps;
2082 
2083  if (format_name == "gmv")
2084  return gmv;
2085 
2086  if (format_name == "tecplot")
2087  return tecplot;
2088 
2089  if (format_name == "tecplot_binary")
2090  return tecplot_binary;
2091 
2092  if (format_name == "vtk")
2093  return vtk;
2094 
2095  if (format_name == "vtu")
2096  return vtu;
2097 
2098  if (format_name == "deal.II intermediate")
2099  return deal_II_intermediate;
2100 
2101  if (format_name == "hdf5")
2102  return hdf5;
2103 
2104  AssertThrow (false,
2105  ExcMessage ("The given file format name is not recognized: <"
2106  + format_name + ">"));
2107 
2108  // return something invalid
2109  return OutputFormat(-1);
2110  }
2111 
2112 
2113 
2114  std::string
2115  get_output_format_names ()
2116  {
2117  return "none|dx|ucd|gnuplot|povray|eps|gmv|tecplot|tecplot_binary|vtk|vtu|hdf5|svg|deal.II intermediate";
2118  }
2119 
2120 
2121 
2122  std::string
2123  default_suffix (const OutputFormat output_format)
2124  {
2125  switch (output_format)
2126  {
2127  case none:
2128  return "";
2129  case dx:
2130  return ".dx";
2131  case ucd:
2132  return ".inp";
2133  case gnuplot:
2134  return ".gnuplot";
2135  case povray:
2136  return ".pov";
2137  case eps:
2138  return ".eps";
2139  case gmv:
2140  return ".gmv";
2141  case tecplot:
2142  return ".dat";
2143  case tecplot_binary:
2144  return ".plt";
2145  case vtk:
2146  return ".vtk";
2147  case vtu:
2148  return ".vtu";
2149  case deal_II_intermediate:
2150  return ".d2";
2151  case hdf5:
2152  return ".h5";
2153  case svg:
2154  return ".svg";
2155  default:
2156  Assert (false, ExcNotImplemented());
2157  return "";
2158  }
2159  }
2160 
2161 
2162 //----------------------------------------------------------------------//
2163 
2164  template <int dim, int spacedim, typename StreamType>
2165  void
2166  write_nodes (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
2167  StreamType &out)
2168  {
2169  Assert (dim<=3, ExcNotImplemented());
2170  unsigned int count = 0;
2171  // We only need this point below,
2172  // but it does not harm to declare
2173  // it here.
2174  Point<spacedim> node;
2175 
2176  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator
2177  patch=patches.begin();
2178  patch!=patches.end(); ++patch)
2179  {
2180  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
2181  const unsigned int n = n_subdivisions+1;
2182  // Length of loops in all
2183  // dimensions. If a dimension
2184  // is not used, a loop of
2185  // length one will do the job.
2186  const unsigned int n1 = (dim>0) ? n : 1;
2187  const unsigned int n2 = (dim>1) ? n : 1;
2188  const unsigned int n3 = (dim>2) ? n : 1;
2189 
2190  for (unsigned int i3=0; i3<n3; ++i3)
2191  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n2; ++i2)
2192  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n1; ++i1)
2193  {
2194  compute_node(node, &*patch,
2195  i1,
2196  i2,
2197  i3,
2198  n_subdivisions);
2199  out.write_point(count++, node);
2200  }
2201  }
2202  out.flush_points ();
2203  }
2204 
2205  template <int dim, int spacedim, typename StreamType>
2206  void
2207  write_cells (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
2208  StreamType &out)
2209  {
2210  Assert (dim<=3, ExcNotImplemented());
2211  unsigned int count = 0;
2212  unsigned int first_vertex_of_patch = 0;
2213  // Array to hold all the node
2214  // numbers of a cell. 8 is
2215  // sufficient for 3D
2216  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator
2217  patch=patches.begin();
2218  patch!=patches.end(); ++patch)
2219  {
2220  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
2221  const unsigned int n = n_subdivisions+1;
2222  // Length of loops in all dimensons
2223  const unsigned int n1 = (dim>0) ? n_subdivisions : 1;
2224  const unsigned int n2 = (dim>1) ? n_subdivisions : 1;
2225  const unsigned int n3 = (dim>2) ? n_subdivisions : 1;
2226  // Offsets of outer loops
2227  unsigned int d1 = 1;
2228  unsigned int d2 = n;
2229  unsigned int d3 = n*n;
2230  for (unsigned int i3=0; i3<n3; ++i3)
2231  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n2; ++i2)
2232  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n1; ++i1)
2233  {
2234  const unsigned int offset = first_vertex_of_patch+i3*d3+i2*d2+i1*d1;
2235  // First write line in x direction
2236  out.template write_cell<dim>(count++, offset, d1, d2, d3);
2237  }
2238  // finally update the number
2239  // of the first vertex of this patch
2240  first_vertex_of_patch += Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n_subdivisions+1);
2241  }
2242 
2243  out.flush_cells ();
2244  }
2245 
2246 
2247  template <int dim, int spacedim, class StreamType>
2248  void
2249  write_data
2250  (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
2251  unsigned int n_data_sets,
2252  const bool double_precision,
2253  StreamType &out)
2254  {
2255  Assert (dim<=3, ExcNotImplemented());
2256  unsigned int count = 0;
2257 
2258  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch
2259  = patches.begin();
2260  patch != patches.end(); ++patch)
2261  {
2262  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
2263  const unsigned int n = n_subdivisions+1;
2264  // Length of loops in all dimensions
2265  Assert ((patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets && !patch->points_are_available) ||
2266  (patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets+spacedim && patch->points_are_available),
2267  ExcDimensionMismatch (patch->points_are_available
2268  ?
2269  (n_data_sets + spacedim)
2270  :
2271  n_data_sets,
2272  patch->data.n_rows()));
2273  Assert (patch->data.n_cols() == Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n),
2274  ExcInvalidDatasetSize (patch->data.n_cols(), n));
2275 
2276  std::vector<float> floats(n_data_sets);
2277  std::vector<double> doubles(n_data_sets);
2278 
2279  // Data is already in
2280  // lexicographic ordering
2281  for (unsigned int i=0; i<Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n); ++i, ++count)
2282  if (double_precision)
2283  {
2284  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
2285  doubles[data_set] = patch->data(data_set, i);
2286  out.write_dataset(count, doubles);
2287  }
2288  else
2289  {
2290  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
2291  floats[data_set] = patch->data(data_set, i);
2292  out.write_dataset(count, floats);
2293  }
2294  }
2295  }
2296 
2297 
2298 
2299  namespace
2300  {
2309  Point<2> svg_project_point(Point<3> point, Point<3> camera_position, Point<3> camera_direction, Point<3> camera_horizontal, float camera_focus)
2310  {
2311  Point<3> camera_vertical;
2312  camera_vertical[0] = camera_horizontal[1] * camera_direction[2] - camera_horizontal[2] * camera_direction[1];
2313  camera_vertical[1] = camera_horizontal[2] * camera_direction[0] - camera_horizontal[0] * camera_direction[2];
2314  camera_vertical[2] = camera_horizontal[0] * camera_direction[1] - camera_horizontal[1] * camera_direction[0];
2315 
2316  float phi;
2317  phi = camera_focus;
2318  phi /= (point[0] - camera_position[0]) * camera_direction[0] + (point[1] - camera_position[1]) * camera_direction[1] + (point[2] - camera_position[2]) * camera_direction[2];
2319 
2320  Point<3> projection;
2321  projection[0] = camera_position[0] + phi * (point[0] - camera_position[0]);
2322  projection[1] = camera_position[1] + phi * (point[1] - camera_position[1]);
2323  projection[2] = camera_position[2] + phi * (point[2] - camera_position[2]);
2324 
2325  Point<2> projection_decomposition;
2326  projection_decomposition[0] = (projection[0] - camera_position[0] - camera_focus * camera_direction[0]) * camera_horizontal[0];
2327  projection_decomposition[0] += (projection[1] - camera_position[1] - camera_focus * camera_direction[1]) * camera_horizontal[1];
2328  projection_decomposition[0] += (projection[2] - camera_position[2] - camera_focus * camera_direction[2]) * camera_horizontal[2];
2329 
2330  projection_decomposition[1] = (projection[0] - camera_position[0] - camera_focus * camera_direction[0]) * camera_vertical[0];
2331  projection_decomposition[1] += (projection[1] - camera_position[1] - camera_focus * camera_direction[1]) * camera_vertical[1];
2332  projection_decomposition[1] += (projection[2] - camera_position[2] - camera_focus * camera_direction[2]) * camera_vertical[2];
2333 
2334  return projection_decomposition;
2335  }
2336 
2337 
2342  Point<6> svg_get_gradient_parameters(Point<3> points[])
2343  {
2344  Point<3> v_min, v_max, v_inter;
2345 
2346  // Use the Bubblesort algorithm to sort the points with respect to the third coordinate
2347  for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i)
2348  {
2349  for (int j = 0; j < 2-i; ++j)
2350  {
2351  if (points[j][2] > points[j + 1][2])
2352  {
2353  Point<3> temp = points[j];
2354  points[j] = points[j+1];
2355  points[j+1] = temp;
2356  }
2357  }
2358  }
2359 
2360  // save the related three-dimensional vectors v_min, v_inter, and v_max
2361  v_min = points[0];
2362  v_inter = points[1];
2363  v_max = points[2];
2364 
2365  Point<2> A[2];
2366  Point<2> b, gradient;
2367 
2368  // determine the plane offset c
2369  A[0][0] = v_max[0] - v_min[0];
2370  A[0][1] = v_inter[0] - v_min[0];
2371  A[1][0] = v_max[1] - v_min[1];
2372  A[1][1] = v_inter[1] - v_min[1];
2373 
2374  b[0] = - v_min[0];
2375  b[1] = - v_min[1];
2376 
2377  double x, sum;
2378  bool col_change = false;
2379 
2380  if (A[0][0] == 0)
2381  {
2382  col_change = true;
2383 
2384  A[0][0] = A[0][1];
2385  A[0][1] = 0;
2386 
2387  double temp = A[1][0];
2388  A[1][0] = A[1][1];
2389  A[1][1] = temp;
2390  }
2391 
2392  for (unsigned int k = 0; k < 1; k++)
2393  {
2394  for (unsigned int i = k+1; i < 2; i++)
2395  {
2396  x = A[i][k] / A[k][k];
2397 
2398  for (unsigned int j = k+1; j < 2; j++) A[i][j] = A[i][j] - A[k][j] * x;
2399 
2400  b[i] = b[i] - b[k]*x;
2401 
2402  }
2403  }
2404 
2405  b[1] = b[1] / A[1][1];
2406 
2407  for (int i = 0; i >= 0; i--)
2408  {
2409  sum = b[i];
2410 
2411  for (unsigned int j = i+1; j < 2; j++) sum = sum - A[i][j] * b[j];
2412 
2413  b[i] = sum / A[i][i];
2414  }
2415 
2416  if (col_change)
2417  {
2418  double temp = b[0];
2419  b[0] = b[1];
2420  b[1] = temp;
2421  }
2422 
2423  double c = b[0] * (v_max[2] - v_min[2]) + b[1] * (v_inter[2] - v_min[2]) + v_min[2];
2424 
2425  // Determine the first entry of the gradient (phi, cf. documentation)
2426  A[0][0] = v_max[0] - v_min[0];
2427  A[0][1] = v_inter[0] - v_min[0];
2428  A[1][0] = v_max[1] - v_min[1];
2429  A[1][1] = v_inter[1] - v_min[1];
2430 
2431  b[0] = 1.0 - v_min[0];
2432  b[1] = - v_min[1];
2433 
2434  col_change = false;
2435 
2436  if (A[0][0] == 0)
2437  {
2438  col_change = true;
2439 
2440  A[0][0] = A[0][1];
2441  A[0][1] = 0;
2442 
2443  double temp = A[1][0];
2444  A[1][0] = A[1][1];
2445  A[1][1] = temp;
2446  }
2447 
2448  for (unsigned int k = 0; k < 1; k++)
2449  {
2450  for (unsigned int i = k+1; i < 2; i++)
2451  {
2452  x = A[i][k] / A[k][k];
2453 
2454  for (unsigned int j = k+1; j < 2; j++) A[i][j] = A[i][j] - A[k][j] * x;
2455 
2456  b[i] = b[i] - b[k] * x;
2457 
2458  }
2459  }
2460 
2461  b[1]=b[1] / A[1][1];
2462 
2463  for (int i = 0; i >= 0; i--)
2464  {
2465  sum = b[i];
2466 
2467  for (unsigned int j = i+1; j < 2; j++) sum = sum - A[i][j]*b[j];
2468 
2469  b[i] = sum / A[i][i];
2470  }
2471 
2472  if (col_change)
2473  {
2474  double temp = b[0];
2475  b[0] = b[1];
2476  b[1] = temp;
2477  }
2478 
2479  gradient[0] = b[0] * (v_max[2] - v_min[2]) + b[1] * (v_inter[2] - v_min[2]) - c + v_min[2];
2480 
2481  // determine the second entry of the gradient
2482  A[0][0] = v_max[0] - v_min[0];
2483  A[0][1] = v_inter[0] - v_min[0];
2484  A[1][0] = v_max[1] - v_min[1];
2485  A[1][1] = v_inter[1] - v_min[1];
2486 
2487  b[0] = - v_min[0];
2488  b[1] = 1.0 - v_min[1];
2489 
2490  col_change = false;
2491 
2492  if (A[0][0] == 0)
2493  {
2494  col_change = true;
2495 
2496  A[0][0] = A[0][1];
2497  A[0][1] = 0;
2498 
2499  double temp = A[1][0];
2500  A[1][0] = A[1][1];
2501  A[1][1] = temp;
2502  }
2503 
2504  for (unsigned int k = 0; k < 1; k++)
2505  {
2506  for (unsigned int i = k+1; i < 2; i++)
2507  {
2508  x = A[i][k] / A[k][k];
2509 
2510  for (unsigned int j = k+1; j < 2; j++) A[i][j] = A[i][j] - A[k][j] * x;
2511 
2512  b[i] = b[i] - b[k] * x;
2513  }
2514  }
2515 
2516  b[1] = b[1] / A[1][1];
2517 
2518  for (int i = 0; i >= 0; i--)
2519  {
2520  sum = b[i];
2521 
2522  for (unsigned int j = i+1; j < 2; j++) sum = sum - A[i][j] * b[j];
2523 
2524  b[i] = sum / A[i][i];
2525  }
2526 
2527  if (col_change)
2528  {
2529  double temp = b[0];
2530  b[0] = b[1];
2531  b[1] = temp;
2532  }
2533 
2534  gradient[1] = b[0] * (v_max[2] - v_min[2]) + b[1] * (v_inter[2] - v_min[2]) - c + v_min[2];
2535 
2536  // normalize the gradient
2537  double gradient_norm = sqrt(pow(gradient[0], 2.0) + pow(gradient[1], 2.0));
2538  gradient[0] /= gradient_norm;
2539  gradient[1] /= gradient_norm;
2540 
2541  double lambda = - gradient[0] * (v_min[0] - v_max[0]) - gradient[1] * (v_min[1] - v_max[1]);
2542 
2543  Point<6> gradient_parameters;
2544 
2545  gradient_parameters[0] = v_min[0];
2546  gradient_parameters[1] = v_min[1];
2547 
2548  gradient_parameters[2] = v_min[0] + lambda * gradient[0];
2549  gradient_parameters[3] = v_min[1] + lambda * gradient[1];
2550 
2551  gradient_parameters[4] = v_min[2];
2552  gradient_parameters[5] = v_max[2];
2553 
2554  return gradient_parameters;
2555  }
2556  }
2557 
2558 
2559 
2560  template <int dim, int spacedim>
2561  void write_ucd (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
2562  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
2563  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
2564  const UcdFlags &flags,
2565  std::ostream &out)
2566  {
2567  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
2568 
2569 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
2570  // verify that there are indeed
2571  // patches to be written out. most
2572  // of the times, people just forget
2573  // to call build_patches when there
2574  // are no patches, so a warning is
2575  // in order. that said, the
2576  // assertion is disabled if we
2577  // support MPI since then it can
2578  // happen that on the coarsest
2579  // mesh, a processor simply has no
2580  // cells it actually owns, and in
2581  // that case it is legit if there
2582  // are no patches
2583  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
2584 #else
2585  if (patches.size() == 0)
2586  return;
2587 #endif
2588 
2589  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
2590 
2591  UcdStream ucd_out(out, flags);
2592 
2593  // first count the number of cells
2594  // and cells for later use
2595  unsigned int n_nodes;
2596  unsigned int n_cells;
2597  compute_sizes<dim,spacedim> (patches, n_nodes, n_cells);
2599  // preamble
2600  if (flags.write_preamble)
2601  {
2602  out << "# This file was generated by the deal.II library." << '\n'
2603  << "# Date = " << Utilities::System::get_date() << "\n"
2604  << "# Time = " << Utilities::System::get_time() << "\n"
2605  << "#" << '\n'
2606  << "# For a description of the UCD format see the AVS Developer's guide."
2607  << '\n'
2608  << "#" << '\n';
2609  }
2610 
2611  // start with ucd data
2612  out << n_nodes << ' '
2613  << n_cells << ' '
2614  << n_data_sets << ' '
2615  << 0 << ' ' // no cell data at present
2616  << 0 // no model data
2617  << '\n';
2618 
2619  write_nodes(patches, ucd_out);
2620  out << '\n';
2621 
2622  write_cells(patches, ucd_out);
2623  out << '\n';
2624 
2626  // now write data
2627  if (n_data_sets != 0)
2628  {
2629  out << n_data_sets << " "; // number of vectors
2630  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_data_sets; ++i)
2631  out << 1 << ' '; // number of components;
2632  // only 1 supported presently
2633  out << '\n';
2634 
2635  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
2636  out << data_names[data_set]
2637  << ",dimensionless" // no units supported at present
2638  << '\n';
2639 
2640  write_data(patches, n_data_sets, true, ucd_out);
2641  }
2642  // make sure everything now gets to
2643  // disk
2644  out.flush ();
2645 
2646  // assert the stream is still ok
2647  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
2648  }
2649 
2650 
2651  template <int dim, int spacedim>
2652  void write_dx (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
2653  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
2654  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
2655  const DXFlags &flags,
2656  std::ostream &out)
2657  {
2658  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
2659 
2660 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
2661  // verify that there are indeed
2662  // patches to be written out. most
2663  // of the times, people just forget
2664  // to call build_patches when there
2665  // are no patches, so a warning is
2666  // in order. that said, the
2667  // assertion is disabled if we
2668  // support MPI since then it can
2669  // happen that on the coarsest
2670  // mesh, a processor simply has no
2671  // cells it actually owns, and in
2672  // that case it is legit if there
2673  // are no patches
2674  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
2675 #else
2676  if (patches.size() == 0)
2677  return;
2678 #endif
2679  // Stream with special features for dx output
2680  DXStream dx_out(out, flags);
2681 
2682  // Variable counting the offset of
2683  // binary data.
2684  unsigned int offset = 0;
2685 
2686  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
2687 
2688  // first count the number of cells
2689  // and cells for later use
2690  unsigned int n_nodes;
2691  unsigned int n_cells;
2692  compute_sizes<dim,spacedim>(patches, n_nodes, n_cells);
2693  // start with vertices order is
2694  // lexicographical, x varying
2695  // fastest
2696  out << "object \"vertices\" class array type float rank 1 shape " << spacedim
2697  << " items " << n_nodes;
2698 
2699  if (flags.coordinates_binary)
2700  {
2701  out << " lsb ieee data 0" << '\n';
2702  offset += n_nodes * spacedim * sizeof(float);
2703  }
2704  else
2705  {
2706  out << " data follows" << '\n';
2707  write_nodes(patches, dx_out);
2708  }
2709 
2711  // first write the coordinates of all vertices
2712 
2714  // write cells
2715  out << "object \"cells\" class array type int rank 1 shape "
2716  << GeometryInfo<dim>::vertices_per_cell
2717  << " items " << n_cells;
2718 
2719  if (flags.int_binary)
2720  {
2721  out << " lsb binary data " << offset << '\n';
2722  offset += n_cells * sizeof (int);
2723  }
2724  else
2725  {
2726  out << " data follows" << '\n';
2727  write_cells(patches, dx_out);
2728  out << '\n';
2729  }
2730 
2731 
2732  out << "attribute \"element type\" string \"";
2733  if (dim==1) out << "lines";
2734  if (dim==2) out << "quads";
2735  if (dim==3) out << "cubes";
2736  out << "\"" << '\n'
2737  << "attribute \"ref\" string \"positions\"" << '\n';
2738 
2739 //TODO:[GK] Patches must be of same size!
2741  // write neighbor information
2742  if (flags.write_neighbors)
2743  {
2744  out << "object \"neighbors\" class array type int rank 1 shape "
2745  << GeometryInfo<dim>::faces_per_cell
2746  << " items " << n_cells
2747  << " data follows";
2748 
2749  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator
2750  patch=patches.begin();
2751  patch!=patches.end(); ++patch)
2752  {
2753  const unsigned int n = patch->n_subdivisions;
2754  const unsigned int n1 = (dim>0) ? n : 1;
2755  const unsigned int n2 = (dim>1) ? n : 1;
2756  const unsigned int n3 = (dim>2) ? n : 1;
2757  unsigned int cells_per_patch = Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n);
2758  unsigned int dx = 1;
2759  unsigned int dy = n;
2760  unsigned int dz = n*n;
2761 
2762  const unsigned int patch_start = patch->patch_index * cells_per_patch;
2763 
2764  for (unsigned int i3=0; i3<n3; ++i3)
2765  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n2; ++i2)
2766  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n1; ++i1)
2767  {
2768  const unsigned int nx = i1*dx;
2769  const unsigned int ny = i2*dy;
2770  const unsigned int nz = i3*dz;
2771 
2772  out << '\n';
2773  // Direction -x
2774  // Last cell in row
2775  // of other patch
2776  if (i1==0)
2777  {
2778  const unsigned int nn = patch->neighbors[0];
2779  out << '\t';
2780  if (nn != patch->no_neighbor)
2781  out << (nn*cells_per_patch+ny+nz+dx*(n-1));
2782  else
2783  out << "-1";
2784  }
2785  else
2786  {
2787  out << '\t'
2788  << patch_start+nx-dx+ny+nz;
2789  }
2790  // Direction +x
2791  // First cell in row
2792  // of other patch
2793  if (i1 == n-1)
2794  {
2795  const unsigned int nn = patch->neighbors[1];
2796  out << '\t';
2797  if (nn != patch->no_neighbor)
2798  out << (nn*cells_per_patch+ny+nz);
2799  else
2800  out << "-1";
2801  }
2802  else
2803  {
2804  out << '\t'
2805  << patch_start+nx+dx+ny+nz;
2806  }
2807  if (dim<2)
2808  continue;
2809  // Direction -y
2810  if (i2==0)
2811  {
2812  const unsigned int nn = patch->neighbors[2];
2813  out << '\t';
2814  if (nn != patch->no_neighbor)
2815  out << (nn*cells_per_patch+nx+nz+dy*(n-1));
2816  else
2817  out << "-1";
2818  }
2819  else
2820  {
2821  out << '\t'
2822  << patch_start+nx+ny-dy+nz;
2823  }
2824  // Direction +y
2825  if (i2 == n-1)
2826  {
2827  const unsigned int nn = patch->neighbors[3];
2828  out << '\t';
2829  if (nn != patch->no_neighbor)
2830  out << (nn*cells_per_patch+nx+nz);
2831  else
2832  out << "-1";
2833  }
2834  else
2835  {
2836  out << '\t'
2837  << patch_start+nx+ny+dy+nz;
2838  }
2839  if (dim<3)
2840  continue;
2841 
2842  // Direction -z
2843  if (i3==0)
2844  {
2845  const unsigned int nn = patch->neighbors[4];
2846  out << '\t';
2847  if (nn != patch->no_neighbor)
2848  out << (nn*cells_per_patch+nx+ny+dz*(n-1));
2849  else
2850  out << "-1";
2851  }
2852  else
2853  {
2854  out << '\t'
2855  << patch_start+nx+ny+nz-dz;
2856  }
2857  // Direction +z
2858  if (i3 == n-1)
2859  {
2860  const unsigned int nn = patch->neighbors[5];
2861  out << '\t';
2862  if (nn != patch->no_neighbor)
2863  out << (nn*cells_per_patch+nx+ny);
2864  else
2865  out << "-1";
2866  }
2867  else
2868  {
2869  out << '\t'
2870  << patch_start+nx+ny+nz+dz;
2871  }
2872  }
2873  out << '\n';
2874  }
2875  }
2877  // now write data
2878  if (n_data_sets != 0)
2879  {
2880  out << "object \"data\" class array type float rank 1 shape "
2881  << n_data_sets
2882  << " items " << n_nodes;
2883 
2884  if (flags.data_binary)
2885  {
2886  out << " lsb ieee data " << offset << '\n';
2887  offset += n_data_sets * n_nodes * ((flags.data_double)
2888  ? sizeof(double)
2889  : sizeof(float));
2890  }
2891  else
2892  {
2893  out << " data follows" << '\n';
2894  write_data(patches, n_data_sets, flags.data_double, dx_out);
2895  }
2896 
2897  // loop over all patches
2898  out << "attribute \"dep\" string \"positions\"" << '\n';
2899  }
2900  else
2901  {
2902  out << "object \"data\" class constantarray type float rank 0 items " << n_nodes << " data follows"
2903  << '\n' << '0' << '\n';
2904  }
2905 
2906  // no model data
2907 
2908  out << "object \"deal data\" class field" << '\n'
2909  << "component \"positions\" value \"vertices\"" << '\n'
2910  << "component \"connections\" value \"cells\"" << '\n'
2911  << "component \"data\" value \"data\"" << '\n';
2912 
2913  if (flags.write_neighbors)
2914  out << "component \"neighbors\" value \"neighbors\"" << '\n';
2915 
2916  {
2917  out << "attribute \"created\" string \""
2918  << Utilities::System::get_date()
2919  << ' '
2920  << Utilities::System::get_time() << '"' << '\n';
2921  }
2922 
2923  out << "end" << '\n';
2924  // Write all binary data now
2925  if (flags.coordinates_binary)
2926  write_nodes(patches, dx_out);
2927  if (flags.int_binary)
2928  write_cells(patches, dx_out);
2929  if (flags.data_binary)
2930  write_data(patches, n_data_sets, flags.data_double, dx_out);
2931 
2932  // make sure everything now gets to
2933  // disk
2934  out.flush ();
2935 
2936  // assert the stream is still ok
2937  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
2938  }
2939 
2940 
2941 
2942  template <int dim, int spacedim>
2943  void write_gnuplot (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
2944  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
2945  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
2946  const GnuplotFlags &flags,
2947  std::ostream &out)
2948  {
2949  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
2950 
2951 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
2952  // verify that there are indeed
2953  // patches to be written out. most
2954  // of the times, people just forget
2955  // to call build_patches when there
2956  // are no patches, so a warning is
2957  // in order. that said, the
2958  // assertion is disabled if we
2959  // support MPI since then it can
2960  // happen that on the coarsest
2961  // mesh, a processor simply has no
2962  // cells it actually owns, and in
2963  // that case it is legit if there
2964  // are no patches
2965  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
2966 #else
2967  if (patches.size() == 0)
2968  return;
2969 #endif
2970 
2971  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
2972 
2973  // write preamble
2974  {
2975  out << "# This file was generated by the deal.II library." << '\n'
2976  << "# Date = " << Utilities::System::get_date() << '\n'
2977  << "# Time = " << Utilities::System::get_time() << '\n'
2978  << "#" << '\n'
2979  << "# For a description of the GNUPLOT format see the GNUPLOT manual."
2980  << '\n'
2981  << "#" << '\n'
2982  << "# ";
2983 
2984  AssertThrow(spacedim <= flags.space_dimension_labels.size(),
2985  GnuplotFlags::ExcNotEnoughSpaceDimensionLabels());
2986  for (unsigned int spacedim_n=0; spacedim_n<spacedim; ++spacedim_n)
2987  {
2988  out << '<' << flags.space_dimension_labels.at(spacedim_n) << "> ";
2989  }
2990 
2991  for (unsigned int i=0; i<data_names.size(); ++i)
2992  out << '<' << data_names[i] << "> ";
2993  out << '\n';
2994  }
2995 
2996 
2997  // loop over all patches
2998  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch=patches.begin();
2999  patch != patches.end(); ++patch)
3000  {
3001  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
3002  const unsigned int n = n_subdivisions+1;
3003  // Length of loops in all dimensions
3004  const unsigned int n1 = (dim>0) ? n : 1;
3005  const unsigned int n2 = (dim>1) ? n : 1;
3006  const unsigned int n3 = (dim>2) ? n : 1;
3007  unsigned int d1 = 1;
3008  unsigned int d2 = n;
3009  unsigned int d3 = n*n;
3010 
3011  Assert ((patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets && !patch->points_are_available) ||
3012  (patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets+spacedim && patch->points_are_available),
3013  ExcDimensionMismatch (patch->points_are_available
3014  ?
3015  (n_data_sets + spacedim)
3016  :
3017  n_data_sets,
3018  patch->data.n_rows()));
3019  Assert (patch->data.n_cols() == Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n),
3020  ExcInvalidDatasetSize (patch->data.n_cols(), n_subdivisions+1));
3021 
3022  Point<spacedim> this_point;
3023  Point<spacedim> node;
3024  if (dim<3)
3025  {
3026  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n2; ++i2)
3027  {
3028  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n1; ++i1)
3029  {
3030  // compute coordinates for
3031  // this patch point
3032  compute_node(node, &*patch, i1, i2, 0, n_subdivisions);
3033  out << node << ' ';
3034 
3035  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
3036  out << patch->data(data_set,i1*d1+i2*d2) << ' ';
3037  out << '\n';
3038  }
3039  // end of row in patch
3040  if (dim>1)
3041  out << '\n';
3042  }
3043  // end of patch
3044  if (dim==1)
3045  out << '\n';
3046  out << '\n';
3047  }
3048  else if (dim==3)
3049  {
3050  // for all grid points: draw
3051  // lines into all positive
3052  // coordinate directions if
3053  // there is another grid point
3054  // there
3055  for (unsigned int i3=0; i3<n3; ++i3)
3056  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n2; ++i2)
3057  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n1; ++i1)
3058  {
3059  // compute coordinates for
3060  // this patch point
3061  compute_node(this_point, &*patch, i1, i2, i3, n_subdivisions);
3062  // line into positive x-direction
3063  // if possible
3064  if (i1 < n_subdivisions)
3065  {
3066  // write point here
3067  // and its data
3068  out << this_point;
3069  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
3070  out << ' '
3071  << patch->data(data_set,i1*d1+i2*d2+i3*d3);
3072  out << '\n';
3073 
3074  // write point there
3075  // and its data
3076  compute_node(node, &*patch, i1+1, i2, i3, n_subdivisions);
3077  out << node;
3078 
3079  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
3080  out << ' '
3081  << patch->data(data_set,(i1+1)*d1+i2*d2+i3*d3);
3082  out << '\n';
3083 
3084  // end of line
3085  out << '\n'
3086  << '\n';
3087  }
3088 
3089  // line into positive y-direction
3090  // if possible
3091  if (i2 < n_subdivisions)
3092  {
3093  // write point here
3094  // and its data
3095  out << this_point;
3096  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
3097  out << ' '
3098  << patch->data(data_set, i1*d1+i2*d2+i3*d3);
3099  out << '\n';
3100 
3101  // write point there
3102  // and its data
3103  compute_node(node, &*patch, i1, i2+1, i3, n_subdivisions);
3104  out << node;
3105 
3106  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
3107  out << ' '
3108  << patch->data(data_set,i1*d1+(i2+1)*d2+i3*d3);
3109  out << '\n';
3110 
3111  // end of line
3112  out << '\n'
3113  << '\n';
3114  }
3115 
3116  // line into positive z-direction
3117  // if possible
3118  if (i3 < n_subdivisions)
3119  {
3120  // write point here
3121  // and its data
3122  out << this_point;
3123  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
3124  out << ' '
3125  << patch->data(data_set,i1*d1+i2*d2+i3*d3);
3126  out << '\n';
3127 
3128  // write point there
3129  // and its data
3130  compute_node(node, &*patch, i1, i2, i3+1, n_subdivisions);
3131  out << node;
3132 
3133  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
3134  out << ' '
3135  << patch->data(data_set,i1*d1+i2*d2+(i3+1)*d3);
3136  out << '\n';
3137  // end of line
3138  out << '\n'
3139  << '\n';
3140  }
3141 
3142  }
3143  }
3144  else
3145  Assert (false, ExcNotImplemented());
3146  }
3147  // make sure everything now gets to
3148  // disk
3149  out.flush ();
3150 
3151  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
3152  }
3153 
3154 
3155 
3156  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3157  void write_povray (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
3158  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
3159  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
3160  const PovrayFlags &flags,
3161  std::ostream &out)
3162  {
3163  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
3164 
3165 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
3166  // verify that there are indeed
3167  // patches to be written out. most
3168  // of the times, people just forget
3169  // to call build_patches when there
3170  // are no patches, so a warning is
3171  // in order. that said, the
3172  // assertion is disabled if we
3173  // support MPI since then it can
3174  // happen that on the coarsest
3175  // mesh, a processor simply has no
3176  // cells it actually owns, and in
3177  // that case it is legit if there
3178  // are no patches
3179  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
3180 #else
3181  if (patches.size() == 0)
3182  return;
3183 #endif
3184  Assert (dim==2, ExcNotImplemented()); // only for 2-D surfaces on a 2-D plane
3185  Assert (spacedim==2, ExcNotImplemented());
3186 
3187  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
3188  (void)n_data_sets;
3189 
3190  // write preamble
3191  {
3192  out << "/* This file was generated by the deal.II library." << '\n'
3193  << " Date = " << Utilities::System::get_date() << '\n'
3194  << " Time = " << Utilities::System::get_time() << '\n'
3195  << '\n'
3196  << " For a description of the POVRAY format see the POVRAY manual."
3197  << '\n'
3198  << "*/ " << '\n';
3199 
3200  // include files
3201  out << "#include \"colors.inc\" " << '\n'
3202  << "#include \"textures.inc\" " << '\n';
3203 
3204 
3205  // use external include file for textures,
3206  // camera and light
3207  if (flags.external_data)
3208  out << "#include \"data.inc\" " << '\n';
3209  else // all definitions in data file
3210  {
3211  // camera
3212  out << '\n' << '\n'
3213  << "camera {" << '\n'
3214  << " location <1,4,-7>" << '\n'
3215  << " look_at <0,0,0>" << '\n'
3216  << " angle 30" << '\n'
3217  << "}" << '\n';
3218 
3219  // light
3220  out << '\n'
3221  << "light_source {" << '\n'
3222  << " <1,4,-7>" << '\n'
3223  << " color Grey" << '\n'
3224  << "}" << '\n';
3225  out << '\n'
3226  << "light_source {" << '\n'
3227  << " <0,20,0>" << '\n'
3228  << " color White" << '\n'
3229  << "}" << '\n';
3230  }
3231  }
3232 
3233  // max. and min. heigth of solution
3234  Assert(patches.size()>0, ExcInternalError());
3235  double hmin=patches[0].data(0,0);
3236  double hmax=patches[0].data(0,0);
3237 
3238  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch=patches.begin();
3239  patch != patches.end(); ++patch)
3240  {
3241  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
3242 
3243  Assert ((patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets && !patch->points_are_available) ||
3244  (patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets+spacedim && patch->points_are_available),
3245  ExcDimensionMismatch (patch->points_are_available
3246  ?
3247  (n_data_sets + spacedim)
3248  :
3249  n_data_sets,
3250  patch->data.n_rows()));
