3251  Assert (patch->data.n_cols() == Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n_subdivisions+1),
3252  ExcInvalidDatasetSize (patch->data.n_cols(), n_subdivisions+1));
3253 
3254  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_subdivisions+1; ++i)
3255  for (unsigned int j=0; j<n_subdivisions+1; ++j)
3256  {
3257  const int dl = i*(n_subdivisions+1)+j;
3258  if (patch->data(0,dl)<hmin)
3259  hmin=patch->data(0,dl);
3260  if (patch->data(0,dl)>hmax)
3261  hmax=patch->data(0,dl);
3262  }
3263  }
3264 
3265  out << "#declare HMIN=" << hmin << ";" << '\n'
3266  << "#declare HMAX=" << hmax << ";" << '\n' << '\n';
3267 
3268  if (!flags.external_data)
3269  {
3270  // texture with scaled niveau lines
3271  // 10 lines in the surface
3272  out << "#declare Tex=texture{" << '\n'
3273  << " pigment {" << '\n'
3274  << " gradient y" << '\n'
3275  << " scale y*(HMAX-HMIN)*" << 0.1 << '\n'
3276  << " color_map {" << '\n'
3277  << " [0.00 color Light_Purple] " << '\n'
3278  << " [0.95 color Light_Purple] " << '\n'
3279  << " [1.00 color White] " << '\n'
3280  << "} } }" << '\n' << '\n';
3281  }
3282 
3283  if (!flags.bicubic_patch)
3284  {
3285  // start of mesh header
3286  out << '\n'
3287  << "mesh {" << '\n';
3288  }
3289 
3290  // loop over all patches
3291  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch=patches.begin();
3292  patch != patches.end(); ++patch)
3293  {
3294  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
3295  const unsigned int n = n_subdivisions+1;
3296  const unsigned int d1=1;
3297  const unsigned int d2=n;
3298 
3299  Assert ((patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets && !patch->points_are_available) ||
3300  (patch->data.n_rows() == n_data_sets+spacedim && patch->points_are_available),
3301  ExcDimensionMismatch (patch->points_are_available
3302  ?
3303  (n_data_sets + spacedim)
3304  :
3305  n_data_sets,
3306  patch->data.n_rows()));
3307  Assert (patch->data.n_cols() == Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n),
3308  ExcInvalidDatasetSize (patch->data.n_cols(), n_subdivisions+1));
3309 
3310 
3311  std::vector<Point<spacedim> > ver(n*n);
3312 
3313  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n; ++i2)
3314  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n; ++i1)
3315  {
3316  // compute coordinates for
3317  // this patch point, storing in ver
3318  compute_node(ver[i1*d1+i2*d2], &*patch, i1, i2, 0, n_subdivisions);
3319  }
3320 
3321 
3322  if (!flags.bicubic_patch)
3323  {
3324  // approximate normal
3325  // vectors in patch
3326  std::vector<Point<3> > nrml;
3327  // only if smooth triangles are used
3328  if (flags.smooth)
3329  {
3330  nrml.resize(n*n);
3331  // These are
3332  // difference
3333  // quotients of
3334  // the surface
3335  // mapping. We
3336  // take them
3337  // symmetric
3338  // inside the
3339  // patch and
3340  // one-sided at
3341  // the edges
3342  Point<3> h1,h2;
3343  // Now compute normals in every point
3344  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n; ++i)
3345  for (unsigned int j=0; j<n; ++j)
3346  {
3347  const unsigned int il = (i==0) ? i : (i-1);
3348  const unsigned int ir = (i==n_subdivisions) ? i : (i+1);
3349  const unsigned int jl = (j==0) ? j : (j-1);
3350  const unsigned int jr = (j==n_subdivisions) ? j : (j+1);
3351 
3352  h1(0)=ver[ir*d1+j*d2](0) - ver[il*d1+j*d2](0);
3353  h1(1)=patch->data(0,ir*d1+j*d2)-
3354  patch->data(0,il*d1+j*d2);
3355  h1(2)=ver[ir*d1+j*d2](1) - ver[il*d1+j*d2](1);
3356 
3357  h2(0)=ver[i*d1+jr*d2](0) - ver[i*d1+jl*d2](0);
3358  h2(1)=patch->data(0,i*d1+jr*d2)-
3359  patch->data(0,i*d1+jl*d2);
3360  h2(2)=ver[i*d1+jr*d2](1) - ver[i*d1+jl*d2](1);
3361 
3362  nrml[i*d1+j*d2](0)=h1(1)*h2(2)-h1(2)*h2(1);
3363  nrml[i*d1+j*d2](1)=h1(2)*h2(0)-h1(0)*h2(2);
3364  nrml[i*d1+j*d2](2)=h1(0)*h2(1)-h1(1)*h2(0);
3365 
3366  // normalize Vector
3367  double norm=std::sqrt(
3368  std::pow(nrml[i*d1+j*d2](0),2.)+
3369  std::pow(nrml[i*d1+j*d2](1),2.)+
3370  std::pow(nrml[i*d1+j*d2](2),2.));
3371 
3372  if (nrml[i*d1+j*d2](1)<0)
3373  norm*=-1.;
3374 
3375  for (unsigned int k=0; k<3; ++k)
3376  nrml[i*d1+j*d2](k)/=norm;
3377  }
3378  }
3379 
3380  // setting up triangles
3381  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_subdivisions; ++i)
3382  for (unsigned int j=0; j<n_subdivisions; ++j)
3383  {
3384  // down/left vertex of triangle
3385  const int dl = i*d1+j*d2;
3386  if (flags.smooth)
3387  {
3388  // writing smooth_triangles
3389 
3390  // down/right triangle
3391  out << "smooth_triangle {" << '\n' << "\t<"
3392  << ver[dl](0) << ","
3393  << patch->data(0,dl) << ","
3394  << ver[dl](1) << ">, <"
3395  << nrml[dl](0) << ", "
3396  << nrml[dl](1) << ", "
3397  << nrml[dl](2)
3398  << ">," << '\n';
3399  out << " \t<"
3400  << ver[dl+d1](0) << ","
3401  << patch->data(0,dl+d1) << ","
3402  << ver[dl+d1](1) << ">, <"
3403  << nrml[dl+d1](0) << ", "
3404  << nrml[dl+d1](1) << ", "
3405  << nrml[dl+d1](2)
3406  << ">," << '\n';
3407  out << "\t<"
3408  << ver[dl+d1+d2](0) << ","
3409  << patch->data(0,dl+d1+d2) << ","
3410  << ver[dl+d1+d2](1) << ">, <"
3411  << nrml[dl+d1+d2](0) << ", "
3412  << nrml[dl+d1+d2](1) << ", "
3413  << nrml[dl+d1+d2](2)
3414  << ">}" << '\n';
3415 
3416  // upper/left triangle
3417  out << "smooth_triangle {" << '\n' << "\t<"
3418  << ver[dl](0) << ","
3419  << patch->data(0,dl) << ","
3420  << ver[dl](1) << ">, <"
3421  << nrml[dl](0) << ", "
3422  << nrml[dl](1) << ", "
3423  << nrml[dl](2)
3424  << ">," << '\n';
3425  out << "\t<"
3426  << ver[dl+d1+d2](0) << ","
3427  << patch->data(0,dl+d1+d2) << ","
3428  << ver[dl+d1+d2](1) << ">, <"
3429  << nrml[dl+d1+d2](0) << ", "
3430  << nrml[dl+d1+d2](1) << ", "
3431  << nrml[dl+d1+d2](2)
3432  << ">," << '\n';
3433  out << "\t<"
3434  << ver[dl+d2](0) << ","
3435  << patch->data(0,dl+d2) << ","
3436  << ver[dl+d2](1) << ">, <"
3437  << nrml[dl+d2](0) << ", "
3438  << nrml[dl+d2](1) << ", "
3439  << nrml[dl+d2](2)
3440  << ">}" << '\n';
3441  }
3442  else
3443  {
3444  // writing standard triangles
3445  // down/right triangle
3446  out << "triangle {" << '\n' << "\t<"
3447  << ver[dl](0) << ","
3448  << patch->data(0,dl) << ","
3449  << ver[dl](1) << ">," << '\n';
3450  out << "\t<"
3451  << ver[dl+d1](0) << ","
3452  << patch->data(0,dl+d1) << ","
3453  << ver[dl+d1](1) << ">," << '\n';
3454  out << "\t<"
3455  << ver[dl+d1+d2](0) << ","
3456  << patch->data(0,dl+d1+d2) << ","
3457  << ver[dl+d1+d2](1) << ">}" << '\n';
3458 
3459  // upper/left triangle
3460  out << "triangle {" << '\n' << "\t<"
3461  << ver[dl](0) << ","
3462  << patch->data(0,dl) << ","
3463  << ver[dl](1) << ">," << '\n';
3464  out << "\t<"
3465  << ver[dl+d1+d2](0) << ","
3466  << patch->data(0,dl+d1+d2) << ","
3467  << ver[dl+d1+d2](1) << ">," << '\n';
3468  out << "\t<"
3469  << ver[dl+d2](0) << ","
3470  << patch->data(0,dl+d2) << ","
3471  << ver[dl+d2](1) << ">}" << '\n';
3472  }
3473  }
3474  }
3475  else
3476  {
3477  // writing bicubic_patch
3478  Assert (n_subdivisions==3, ExcDimensionMismatch(n_subdivisions,3));
3479  out << '\n'
3480  << "bicubic_patch {" << '\n'
3481  << " type 0" << '\n'
3482  << " flatness 0" << '\n'
3483  << " u_steps 0" << '\n'
3484  << " v_steps 0" << '\n';
3485  for (int i=0; i<16; ++i)
3486  {
3487  out << "\t<" << ver[i](0) << "," << patch->data(0,i) << "," << ver[i](1) << ">";
3488  if (i!=15) out << ",";
3489  out << '\n';
3490  }
3491  out << " texture {Tex}" << '\n'
3492  << "}" << '\n';
3493  }
3494  }
3495 
3496  if (!flags.bicubic_patch)
3497  {
3498  // the end of the mesh
3499  out << " texture {Tex}" << '\n'
3500  << "}" << '\n'
3501  << '\n';
3502  }
3503 
3504  // make sure everything now gets to
3505  // disk
3506  out.flush ();
3507 
3508  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
3509  }
3510 
3511 
3512 
3513  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3514  void write_eps (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &/*patches*/,
3515  const std::vector<std::string> &/*data_names*/,
3516  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
3517  const EpsFlags &/*flags*/,
3518  std::ostream &/*out*/)
3519  {
3520  // not implemented, see the documentation of the function
3521  AssertThrow (dim==2, ExcNotImplemented());
3522  }
3523 
3524 
3525  template <int spacedim>
3526  void write_eps (const std::vector<Patch<2,spacedim> > &patches,
3527  const std::vector<std::string> &/*data_names*/,
3528  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
3529  const EpsFlags &flags,
3530  std::ostream &out)
3531  {
3532  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
3533 
3534 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
3535  // verify that there are indeed
3536  // patches to be written out. most
3537  // of the times, people just forget
3538  // to call build_patches when there
3539  // are no patches, so a warning is
3540  // in order. that said, the
3541  // assertion is disabled if we
3542  // support MPI since then it can
3543  // happen that on the coarsest
3544  // mesh, a processor simply has no
3545  // cells it actually owns, and in
3546  // that case it is legit if there
3547  // are no patches
3548  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
3549 #else
3550  if (patches.size() == 0)
3551  return;
3552 #endif
3553 
3554  const unsigned int old_precision = out.precision();
3555 
3556  // set up an array of cells to be
3557  // written later. this array holds the
3558  // cells of all the patches as
3559  // projected to the plane perpendicular
3560  // to the line of sight.
3561  //
3562  // note that they are kept sorted by
3563  // the set, where we chose the value
3564  // of the center point of the cell
3565  // along the line of sight as value
3566  // for sorting
3567  std::multiset<EpsCell2d> cells;
3568 
3569  // two variables in which we
3570  // will store the minimum and
3571  // maximum values of the field
3572  // to be used for colorization
3573  //
3574  // preset them by 0 to calm down the
3575  // compiler; they are initialized later
3576  double min_color_value=0, max_color_value=0;
3577 
3578  // Array for z-coordinates of points.
3579  // The elevation determined by a function if spacedim=2
3580  // or the z-cooridate of the grid point if spacedim=3
3581  double heights[4] = { 0, 0, 0, 0 };
3582 
3583  // compute the cells for output and
3584  // enter them into the set above
3585  // note that since dim==2, we
3586  // have exactly four vertices per
3587  // patch and per cell
3588  for (typename std::vector<Patch<2,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch=patches.begin();
3589  patch!=patches.end(); ++patch)
3590  {
3591  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
3592  const unsigned int n = n_subdivisions+1;
3593  const unsigned int d1 = 1;
3594  const unsigned int d2 = n;
3595 
3596  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n_subdivisions; ++i2)
3597  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n_subdivisions; ++i1)
3598  {
3599  Point<spacedim> points[4];
3600  compute_node(points[0], &*patch, i1, i2, 0, n_subdivisions);
3601  compute_node(points[1], &*patch, i1+1, i2, 0, n_subdivisions);
3602  compute_node(points[2], &*patch, i1, i2+1, 0, n_subdivisions);
3603  compute_node(points[3], &*patch, i1+1, i2+1, 0, n_subdivisions);
3604 
3605  switch (spacedim)
3606  {
3607  case 2:
3608  Assert ((flags.height_vector < patch->data.n_rows()) ||
3609  patch->data.n_rows() == 0,
3610  ExcIndexRange (flags.height_vector, 0,
3611  patch->data.n_rows()));
3612  heights[0] = patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ?
3613  patch->data(flags.height_vector,i1*d1 + i2*d2) * flags.z_scaling
3614  : 0;
3615  heights[1] = patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ?
3616  patch->data(flags.height_vector,(i1+1)*d1 + i2*d2) * flags.z_scaling
3617  : 0;
3618  heights[2] = patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ?
3619  patch->data(flags.height_vector,i1*d1 + (i2+1)*d2) * flags.z_scaling
3620  : 0;
3621  heights[3] = patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ?
3622  patch->data(flags.height_vector,(i1+1)*d1 + (i2+1)*d2) * flags.z_scaling
3623  : 0;
3624 
3625  break;
3626  case 3:
3627  // Copy z-coordinates into the height vector
3628  for (unsigned int i=0; i<4; ++i)
3629  heights[i] = points[i](2);
3630  break;
3631  default:
3632  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
3633  }
3634 
3635 
3636  // now compute the projection of
3637  // the bilinear cell given by the
3638  // four vertices and their heights
3639  // and write them to a proper
3640  // cell object. note that we only
3641  // need the first two components
3642  // of the projected position for
3643  // output, but we need the value
3644  // along the line of sight for
3645  // sorting the cells for back-to-
3646  // front-output
3647  //
3648  // this computation was first written
3649  // by Stefan Nauber. please no-one
3650  // ask me why it works that way (or
3651  // may be not), especially not about
3652  // the angles and the sign of
3653  // the height field, I don't know
3654  // it.
3655  EpsCell2d eps_cell;
3656  const double pi = numbers::PI;
3657  const double cx = -std::cos(pi-flags.azimut_angle * 2*pi / 360.),
3658  cz = -std::cos(flags.turn_angle * 2*pi / 360.),
3659  sx = std::sin(pi-flags.azimut_angle * 2*pi / 360.),
3660  sz = std::sin(flags.turn_angle * 2*pi / 360.);
3661  for (unsigned int vertex=0; vertex<4; ++vertex)
3662  {
3663  const double x = points[vertex](0),
3664  y = points[vertex](1),
3665  z = -heights[vertex];
3666 
3667  eps_cell.vertices[vertex](0) = - cz*x+ sz*y;
3668  eps_cell.vertices[vertex](1) = -cx*sz*x-cx*cz*y-sx*z;
3669 
3670  // ( 1 0 0 )
3671  // D1 = ( 0 cx -sx )
3672  // ( 0 sx cx )
3673 
3674  // ( cy 0 sy )
3675  // Dy = ( 0 1 0 )
3676  // (-sy 0 cy )
3677 
3678  // ( cz -sz 0 )
3679  // Dz = ( sz cz 0 )
3680  // ( 0 0 1 )
3681 
3682 // ( cz -sz 0 )( 1 0 0 )(x) ( cz*x-sz*(cx*y-sx*z)+0*(sx*y+cx*z) )
3683 // Dxz = ( sz cz 0 )( 0 cx -sx )(y) = ( sz*x+cz*(cx*y-sx*z)+0*(sx*y+cx*z) )
3684 // ( 0 0 1 )( 0 sx cx )(z) ( 0*x+ *(cx*y-sx*z)+1*(sx*y+cx*z) )
3685  }
3686 
3687  // compute coordinates of
3688  // center of cell
3689  const Point<spacedim> center_point
3690  = (points[0] + points[1] + points[2] + points[3]) / 4;
3691  const double center_height
3692  = -(heights[0] + heights[1] + heights[2] + heights[3]) / 4;
3693 
3694  // compute the depth into
3695  // the picture
3696  eps_cell.depth = -sx*sz*center_point(0)
3697  -sx*cz*center_point(1)
3698  +cx*center_height;
3699 
3700  if (flags.draw_cells && flags.shade_cells)
3701  {
3702  Assert ((flags.color_vector < patch->data.n_rows()) ||
3703  patch->data.n_rows() == 0,
3704  ExcIndexRange (flags.color_vector, 0,
3705  patch->data.n_rows()));
3706  const double color_values[4]
3707  = { patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ?
3708  patch->data(flags.color_vector,i1 *d1 + i2 *d2) : 1,
3709 
3710  patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ?
3711  patch->data(flags.color_vector,(i1+1)*d1 + i2 *d2) : 1,
3712 
3713  patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ?
3714  patch->data(flags.color_vector,i1 *d1 + (i2+1)*d2) : 1,
3715 
3716  patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ?
3717  patch->data(flags.color_vector,(i1+1)*d1 + (i2+1)*d2) : 1
3718  };
3719 
3720  // set color value to average of the value
3721  // at the vertices
3722  eps_cell.color_value = (color_values[0] +
3723  color_values[1] +
3724  color_values[3] +
3725  color_values[2]) / 4;
3726 
3727  // update bounds of color
3728  // field
3729  if (patch == patches.begin())
3730  min_color_value = max_color_value = eps_cell.color_value;
3731  else
3732  {
3733  min_color_value = (min_color_value < eps_cell.color_value ?
3734  min_color_value : eps_cell.color_value);
3735  max_color_value = (max_color_value > eps_cell.color_value ?
3736  max_color_value : eps_cell.color_value);
3737  }
3738  }
3739 
3740  // finally add this cell
3741  cells.insert (eps_cell);
3742  }
3743  }
3744 
3745  // find out minimum and maximum x and
3746  // y coordinates to compute offsets
3747  // and scaling factors
3748  double x_min = cells.begin()->vertices[0](0);
3749  double x_max = x_min;
3750  double y_min = cells.begin()->vertices[0](1);
3751  double y_max = y_min;
3752 
3753  for (typename std::multiset<EpsCell2d>::const_iterator
3754  cell=cells.begin();
3755  cell!=cells.end(); ++cell)
3756  for (unsigned int vertex=0; vertex<4; ++vertex)
3757  {
3758  x_min = std::min (x_min, cell->vertices[vertex](0));
3759  x_max = std::max (x_max, cell->vertices[vertex](0));
3760  y_min = std::min (y_min, cell->vertices[vertex](1));
3761  y_max = std::max (y_max, cell->vertices[vertex](1));
3762  }
3763 
3764  // scale in x-direction such that
3765  // in the output 0 <= x <= 300.
3766  // don't scale in y-direction to
3767  // preserve the shape of the
3768  // triangulation
3769  const double scale = (flags.size /
3770  (flags.size_type==EpsFlags::width ?
3771  x_max - x_min :
3772  y_min - y_max));
3773 
3774  const Point<2> offset(x_min, y_min);
3775 
3776 
3777  // now write preamble
3778  {
3779  out << "%!PS-Adobe-2.0 EPSF-1.2" << '\n'
3780  << "%%Title: deal.II Output" << '\n'
3781  << "%%Creator: the deal.II library" << '\n'
3782  << "%%Creation Date: "
3783  << Utilities::System::get_date()
3784  << " - "
3785  << Utilities::System::get_time() << '\n'
3786  << "%%BoundingBox: "
3787  // lower left corner
3788  << "0 0 "
3789  // upper right corner
3790  << static_cast<unsigned int>( (x_max-x_min) * scale + 0.5)
3791  << ' '
3792  << static_cast<unsigned int>( (y_max-y_min) * scale + 0.5)
3793  << '\n';
3794 
3795  // define some abbreviations to keep
3796  // the output small:
3797  // m=move turtle to
3798  // l=define a line
3799  // s=set rgb color
3800  // sg=set gray value
3801  // lx=close the line and plot the line
3802  // lf=close the line and fill the interior
3803  out << "/m {moveto} bind def" << '\n'
3804  << "/l {lineto} bind def" << '\n'
3805  << "/s {setrgbcolor} bind def" << '\n'
3806  << "/sg {setgray} bind def" << '\n'
3807  << "/lx {lineto closepath stroke} bind def" << '\n'
3808  << "/lf {lineto closepath fill} bind def" << '\n';
3809 
3810  out << "%%EndProlog" << '\n'
3811  << '\n';
3812  // set fine lines
3813  out << flags.line_width << " setlinewidth" << '\n';
3814  // allow only five digits
3815  // for output (instead of the
3816  // default six); this should suffice
3817  // even for fine grids, but reduces
3818  // the file size significantly
3819  out << std::setprecision (5);
3820  }
3821 
3822  // check if min and max
3823  // values for the color are
3824  // actually different. If
3825  // that is not the case (such
3826  // things happen, for
3827  // example, in the very first
3828  // time step of a time
3829  // dependent problem, if the
3830  // initial values are zero),
3831  // all values are equal, and
3832  // then we can draw
3833  // everything in an arbitrary
3834  // color. Thus, change one of
3835  // the two values arbitrarily
3836  if (max_color_value == min_color_value)
3837  max_color_value = min_color_value+1;
3838 
3839  // now we've got all the information
3840  // we need. write the cells.
3841  // note: due to the ordering, we
3842  // traverse the list of cells
3843  // back-to-front
3844  for (typename std::multiset<EpsCell2d>::const_iterator
3845  cell=cells.begin();
3846  cell!=cells.end(); ++cell)
3847  {
3848  if (flags.draw_cells)
3849  {
3850  if (flags.shade_cells)
3851  {
3852  const EpsFlags::RgbValues rgb_values
3853  = (*flags.color_function) (cell->color_value,
3854  min_color_value,
3855  max_color_value);
3856 
3857  // write out color
3858  if (rgb_values.is_grey())
3859  out << rgb_values.red << " sg ";
3860  else
3861  out << rgb_values.red << ' '
3862  << rgb_values.green << ' '
3863  << rgb_values.blue << " s ";
3864  }
3865  else
3866  out << "1 sg ";
3867 
3868  out << (cell->vertices[0]-offset) * scale << " m "
3869  << (cell->vertices[1]-offset) * scale << " l "
3870  << (cell->vertices[3]-offset) * scale << " l "
3871  << (cell->vertices[2]-offset) * scale << " lf"
3872  << '\n';
3873  }
3874 
3875  if (flags.draw_mesh)
3876  out << "0 sg " // draw lines in black
3877  << (cell->vertices[0]-offset) * scale << " m "
3878  << (cell->vertices[1]-offset) * scale << " l "
3879  << (cell->vertices[3]-offset) * scale << " l "
3880  << (cell->vertices[2]-offset) * scale << " lx"
3881  << '\n';
3882  }
3883  out << "showpage" << '\n';
3884  // make sure everything now gets to
3885  // disk
3886  out << std::setprecision(old_precision);
3887  out.flush ();
3888 
3889  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
3890  }
3891 
3892 
3893 
3894  template <int dim, int spacedim>
3895  void write_gmv (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
3896  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
3897  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
3898  const GmvFlags &flags,
3899  std::ostream &out)
3900  {
3901  Assert(dim<=3, ExcNotImplemented());
3902  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
3903 
3904 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
3905  // verify that there are indeed
3906  // patches to be written out. most
3907  // of the times, people just forget
3908  // to call build_patches when there
3909  // are no patches, so a warning is
3910  // in order. that said, the
3911  // assertion is disabled if we
3912  // support MPI since then it can
3913  // happen that on the coarsest
3914  // mesh, a processor simply has no
3915  // cells it actually owns, and in
3916  // that case it is legit if there
3917  // are no patches
3918  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
3919 #else
3920  if (patches.size() == 0)
3921  return;
3922 #endif
3923 
3924  GmvStream gmv_out(out, flags);
3925  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
3926  // check against # of data sets in
3927  // first patch. checks against all
3928  // other patches are made in
3929  // write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors
3930  Assert ((patches[0].data.n_rows() == n_data_sets && !patches[0].points_are_available) ||
3931  (patches[0].data.n_rows() == n_data_sets+spacedim && patches[0].points_are_available),
3932  ExcDimensionMismatch (patches[0].points_are_available
3933  ?
3934  (n_data_sets + spacedim)
3935  :
3936  n_data_sets,
3937  patches[0].data.n_rows()));
3938 
3940  // preamble
3941  out << "gmvinput ascii"
3942  << '\n'
3943  << '\n';
3944 
3945  // first count the number of cells
3946  // and cells for later use
3947  unsigned int n_nodes;
3948  unsigned int n_cells;
3949  compute_sizes<dim,spacedim>(patches, n_nodes, n_cells);
3950 
3951  // in gmv format the vertex
3952  // coordinates and the data have an
3953  // order that is a bit unpleasant
3954  // (first all x coordinates, then
3955  // all y coordinate, ...; first all
3956  // data of variable 1, then
3957  // variable 2, etc), so we have to
3958  // copy the data vectors a bit around
3959  //
3960  // note that we copy vectors when
3961  // looping over the patches since we
3962  // have to write them one variable
3963  // at a time and don't want to use
3964  // more than one loop
3965  //
3966  // this copying of data vectors can
3967  // be done while we already output
3968  // the vertices, so do this on a
3969  // separate task and when wanting
3970  // to write out the data, we wait
3971  // for that task to finish
3972  Table<2,double> data_vectors (n_data_sets, n_nodes);
3973  void (*fun_ptr) (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &,
3974  Table<2,double> &)
3975  = &write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors<dim,spacedim>;
3976  Threads::Task<> reorder_task = Threads::new_task (fun_ptr, patches, data_vectors);
3977 
3979  // first make up a list of used
3980  // vertices along with their
3981  // coordinates
3982  //
3983  // note that we have to print
3984  // 3 dimensions
3985  out << "nodes " << n_nodes << '\n';
3986  for (unsigned int d=0; d<spacedim; ++d)
3987  {
3988  gmv_out.selected_component = d;
3989  write_nodes(patches, gmv_out);
3990  out << '\n';
3991  }
3992  gmv_out.selected_component = numbers::invalid_unsigned_int;
3993 
3994  for (unsigned int d=spacedim; d<3; ++d)
3995  {
3996  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_nodes; ++i)
3997  out << "0 ";
3998  out << '\n';
3999  }
4000 
4002  // now for the cells. note that
4003  // vertices are counted from 1 onwards
4004  out << "cells " << n_cells << '\n';
4005  write_cells(patches, gmv_out);
4006 
4008  // data output.
4009  out << "variable" << '\n';
4010 
4011  // now write the data vectors to
4012  // @p{out} first make sure that all
4013  // data is in place
4014  reorder_task.join ();
4015 
4016  // then write data.
4017  // the '1' means: node data (as opposed
4018  // to cell data, which we do not
4019  // support explicitly here)
4020  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
4021  {
4022  out << data_names[data_set] << " 1" << '\n';
4023  std::copy (data_vectors[data_set].begin(),
4024  data_vectors[data_set].end(),
4025  std::ostream_iterator<double>(out, " "));
4026  out << '\n'
4027  << '\n';
4028  }
4029 
4030 
4031 
4032  // end of variable section
4033  out << "endvars" << '\n';
4034 
4035  // end of output
4036  out << "endgmv"
4037  << '\n';
4038 
4039  // make sure everything now gets to
4040  // disk
4041  out.flush ();
4042 
4043  // assert the stream is still ok
4044  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4045  }
4046 
4047 
4048 
4049  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4050  void write_tecplot (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
4051  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
4052  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
4053  const TecplotFlags &flags,
4054  std::ostream &out)
4055  {
4056  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4057 
4058 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
4059  // verify that there are indeed
4060  // patches to be written out. most
4061  // of the times, people just forget
4062  // to call build_patches when there
4063  // are no patches, so a warning is
4064  // in order. that said, the
4065  // assertion is disabled if we
4066  // support MPI since then it can
4067  // happen that on the coarsest
4068  // mesh, a processor simply has no
4069  // cells it actually owns, and in
4070  // that case it is legit if there
4071  // are no patches
4072  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
4073 #else
4074  if (patches.size() == 0)
4075  return;
4076 #endif
4077 
4078  TecplotStream tecplot_out(out, flags);
4079 
4080  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
4081  // check against # of data sets in
4082  // first patch. checks against all
4083  // other patches are made in
4084  // write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors
4085  Assert ((patches[0].data.n_rows() == n_data_sets && !patches[0].points_are_available) ||
4086  (patches[0].data.n_rows() == n_data_sets+spacedim && patches[0].points_are_available),
4087  ExcDimensionMismatch (patches[0].points_are_available
4088  ?
4089  (n_data_sets + spacedim)
4090  :
4091  n_data_sets,
4092  patches[0].data.n_rows()));
4093 
4094  // first count the number of cells
4095  // and cells for later use
4096  unsigned int n_nodes;
4097  unsigned int n_cells;
4098  compute_sizes<dim,spacedim>(patches, n_nodes, n_cells);
4099 
4101  // preamble
4102  {
4103  out << "# This file was generated by the deal.II library." << '\n'
4104  << "# Date = " << Utilities::System::get_date() << '\n'
4105  << "# Time = " << Utilities::System::get_time() << '\n'
4106  << "#" << '\n'
4107  << "# For a description of the Tecplot format see the Tecplot documentation."
4108  << '\n'
4109  << "#" << '\n';
4110 
4111 
4112  out << "Variables=";
4113 
4114  switch (spacedim)
4115  {
4116  case 1:
4117  out << "\"x\"";
4118  break;
4119  case 2:
4120  out << "\"x\", \"y\"";
4121  break;
4122  case 3:
4123  out << "\"x\", \"y\", \"z\"";
4124  break;
4125  default:
4126  Assert (false, ExcNotImplemented());
4127  }
4128 
4129  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
4130  out << ", \"" << data_names[data_set] << "\"";
4131 
4132  out << '\n';
4133 
4134  out << "zone ";
4135  if (flags.zone_name)
4136  out << "t=\"" << flags.zone_name << "\" ";
4137 
4138  if (flags.solution_time >= 0.0)
4139  out << "strandid=1, solutiontime=" << flags.solution_time <<", ";
4140 
4141  out << "f=feblock, n=" << n_nodes << ", e=" << n_cells
4142  << ", et=" << tecplot_cell_type[dim] << '\n';
4143  }
4144 
4145 
4146  // in Tecplot FEBLOCK format the vertex
4147  // coordinates and the data have an
4148  // order that is a bit unpleasant
4149  // (first all x coordinates, then
4150  // all y coordinate, ...; first all
4151  // data of variable 1, then
4152  // variable 2, etc), so we have to
4153  // copy the data vectors a bit around
4154  //
4155  // note that we copy vectors when
4156  // looping over the patches since we
4157  // have to write them one variable
4158  // at a time and don't want to use
4159  // more than one loop
4160  //
4161  // this copying of data vectors can
4162  // be done while we already output
4163  // the vertices, so do this on a
4164  // separate task and when wanting
4165  // to write out the data, we wait
4166  // for that task to finish
4167 
4168  Table<2,double> data_vectors (n_data_sets, n_nodes);
4169 
4170  void (*fun_ptr) (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &,
4171  Table<2,double> &)
4172  = &write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors<dim,spacedim>;
4173  Threads::Task<> reorder_task = Threads::new_task (fun_ptr, patches, data_vectors);
4174 
4176  // first make up a list of used
4177  // vertices along with their
4178  // coordinates
4179 
4180 
4181  for (unsigned int d=0; d<spacedim; ++d)
4182  {
4183  tecplot_out.selected_component = d;
4184  write_nodes(patches, tecplot_out);
4185  out << '\n';
4186  }
4187 
4188 
4190  // data output.
4191  //
4192  // now write the data vectors to
4193  // @p{out} first make sure that all
4194  // data is in place
4195  reorder_task.join ();
4196 
4197  // then write data.
4198  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
4199  {
4200  std::copy (data_vectors[data_set].begin(),
4201  data_vectors[data_set].end(),
4202  std::ostream_iterator<double>(out, "\n"));
4203  out << '\n';
4204  }
4205 
4206  write_cells(patches, tecplot_out);
4207 
4208  // make sure everything now gets to
4209  // disk
4210  out.flush ();
4211 
4212  // assert the stream is still ok
4213  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4214  }
4215 
4216 
4217 
4218 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
4219 // Macros for handling Tecplot API data
4220 
4221 #ifdef DEAL_II_HAVE_TECPLOT
4222 
4223  namespace
4224  {
4225  class TecplotMacros
4226  {
4227  public:
4228  TecplotMacros(const unsigned int n_nodes = 0,
4229  const unsigned int n_vars = 0,
4230  const unsigned int n_cells = 0,
4231  const unsigned int n_vert = 0);
4232  ~TecplotMacros();
4233  float &nd(const unsigned int i, const unsigned int j);
4234  int &cd(const unsigned int i, const unsigned int j);
4235  std::vector<float> nodalData;
4236  std::vector<int> connData;
4237  private:
4238  unsigned int n_nodes;
4239  unsigned int n_vars;
4240  unsigned int n_cells;
4241  unsigned int n_vert;
4242  };
4243 
4244 
4245  inline
4246  TecplotMacros::TecplotMacros(const unsigned int n_nodes,
4247  const unsigned int n_vars,
4248  const unsigned int n_cells,
4249  const unsigned int n_vert)
4250  :
4251  n_nodes(n_nodes),
4252  n_vars(n_vars),
4253  n_cells(n_cells),
4254  n_vert(n_vert)
4255  {
4256  nodalData.resize(n_nodes*n_vars);
4257  connData.resize(n_cells*n_vert);
4258  }
4259 
4260 
4261 
4262  inline
4263  TecplotMacros::~TecplotMacros()
4264  {}
4265 
4266 
4267 
4268  inline
4269  float &TecplotMacros::nd (const unsigned int i,
4270  const unsigned int j)
4271  {
4272  return nodalData[i*n_nodes+j];
4273  }
4274 
4275 
4276 
4277  inline
4278  int &TecplotMacros::cd (const unsigned int i,
4279  const unsigned int j)
4280  {
4281  return connData[i+j*n_vert];
4282  }
4283 
4284  }
4285 
4286 
4287 #endif
4288 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
4289 
4290 
4291 
4292  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4293  void write_tecplot_binary (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
4294  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
4295  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &vector_data_ranges,
4296  const TecplotFlags &flags,
4297  std::ostream &out)
4298  {
4299 
4300 #ifndef DEAL_II_HAVE_TECPLOT
4301 
4302  // simply call the ASCII output
4303  // function if the Tecplot API
4304  // isn't present
4305  write_tecplot (patches, data_names, vector_data_ranges, flags, out);
4306  return;
4307 
4308 #else
4309 
4310  // Tecplot binary output only good
4311  // for 2D & 3D
4312  if (dim == 1)
4313  {
4314  write_tecplot (patches, data_names, vector_data_ranges, flags, out);
4315  return;
4316  }
4317 
4318  // if the user hasn't specified a
4319  // file name we should call the
4320  // ASCII function and use the
4321  // ostream @p{out} instead of doing
4322  // something silly later
4323  char *file_name = (char *) flags.tecplot_binary_file_name;
4324 
4325  if (file_name == NULL)
4326  {
4327  // At least in debug mode we
4328  // should tell users why they
4329  // don't get tecplot binary
4330  // output
4331  Assert(false, ExcMessage("Specify the name of the tecplot_binary"
4332  " file through the TecplotFlags interface."));
4333  write_tecplot (patches, data_names, vector_data_ranges, flags, out);
4334  return;
4335  }
4336 
4337 
4338  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4339 
4340 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
4341  // verify that there are indeed
4342  // patches to be written out. most
4343  // of the times, people just forget
4344  // to call build_patches when there
4345  // are no patches, so a warning is
4346  // in order. that said, the
4347  // assertion is disabled if we
4348  // support MPI since then it can
4349  // happen that on the coarsest
4350  // mesh, a processor simply has no
4351  // cells it actually owns, and in
4352  // that case it is legit if there
4353  // are no patches
4354  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
4355 #else
4356  if (patches.size() == 0)
4357  return;
4358 #endif
4359 
4360  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
4361  // check against # of data sets in
4362  // first patch. checks against all
4363  // other patches are made in
4364  // write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors
4365  Assert ((patches[0].data.n_rows() == n_data_sets && !patches[0].points_are_available) ||
4366  (patches[0].data.n_rows() == n_data_sets+spacedim && patches[0].points_are_available),
4367  ExcDimensionMismatch (patches[0].points_are_available
4368  ?
4369  (n_data_sets + spacedim)
4370  :
4371  n_data_sets,
4372  patches[0].data.n_rows()));
4373 
4374  // first count the number of cells
4375  // and cells for later use
4376  unsigned int n_nodes;
4377  unsigned int n_cells;
4378  compute_sizes<dim,spacedim>(patches, n_nodes, n_cells);
4379  // local variables only needed to write Tecplot
4380  // binary output files
4381  const unsigned int vars_per_node = (spacedim+n_data_sets),
4382  nodes_per_cell = GeometryInfo<dim>::vertices_per_cell;
4383 
4384  TecplotMacros tm(n_nodes, vars_per_node, n_cells, nodes_per_cell);
4385 
4386  int is_double = 0,
4387  tec_debug = 0,
4388  cell_type = tecplot_binary_cell_type[dim];
4389 
4390  std::string tec_var_names;
4391  switch (spacedim)
4392  {
4393  case 2:
4394  tec_var_names = "x y";
4395  break;
4396  case 3:
4397  tec_var_names = "x y z";
4398  break;
4399  default:
4400  Assert(false, ExcNotImplemented());
4401  }
4402 
4403  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
4404  {
4405  tec_var_names += " ";
4406  tec_var_names += data_names[data_set];
4407  }
4408  // in Tecplot FEBLOCK format the vertex
4409  // coordinates and the data have an
4410  // order that is a bit unpleasant
4411  // (first all x coordinates, then
4412  // all y coordinate, ...; first all
4413  // data of variable 1, then
4414  // variable 2, etc), so we have to
4415  // copy the data vectors a bit around
4416  //
4417  // note that we copy vectors when
4418  // looping over the patches since we
4419  // have to write them one variable
4420  // at a time and don't want to use
4421  // more than one loop
4422  //
4423  // this copying of data vectors can
4424  // be done while we already output
4425  // the vertices, so do this on a
4426  // separate task and when wanting
4427  // to write out the data, we wait
4428  // for that task to finish
4429  Table<2,double> data_vectors (n_data_sets, n_nodes);
4430 
4431  void (*fun_ptr) (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &,
4432  Table<2,double> &)
4433  = &write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors<dim,spacedim>;
4434  Threads::Task<> reorder_task = Threads::new_task (fun_ptr, patches, data_vectors);
4435 
4437  // first make up a list of used
4438  // vertices along with their
4439  // coordinates
4440  for (unsigned int d=1; d<=spacedim; ++d)
4441  {
4442  unsigned int entry=0;
4443 
4444  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch=patches.begin();
4445  patch!=patches.end(); ++patch)
4446  {
4447  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
4448 
4449  switch (dim)
4450  {
4451  case 2:
4452  {
4453  for (unsigned int j=0; j<n_subdivisions+1; ++j)
4454  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_subdivisions+1; ++i)
4455  {
4456  const double x_frac = i * 1./n_subdivisions,
4457  y_frac = j * 1./n_subdivisions;
4458 
4459  tm.nd((d-1),entry) = static_cast<float>(
4460  (((patch->vertices[1](d-1) * x_frac) +
4461  (patch->vertices[0](d-1) * (1-x_frac))) * (1-y_frac) +
4462  ((patch->vertices[3](d-1) * x_frac) +
4463  (patch->vertices[2](d-1) * (1-x_frac))) * y_frac)
4464  );
4465  entry++;
4466  }
4467  break;
4468  }
4469 
4470  case 3:
4471  {
4472  for (unsigned int j=0; j<n_subdivisions+1; ++j)
4473  for (unsigned int k=0; k<n_subdivisions+1; ++k)
4474  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_subdivisions+1; ++i)
4475  {
4476  const double x_frac = i * 1./n_subdivisions,
4477  y_frac = k * 1./n_subdivisions,
4478  z_frac = j * 1./n_subdivisions;
4479 
4480  // compute coordinates for
4481  // this patch point
4482  tm.nd((d-1),entry) = static_cast<float>(
4483  ((((patch->vertices[1](d-1) * x_frac) +
4484  (patch->vertices[0](d-1) * (1-x_frac))) * (1-y_frac) +
4485  ((patch->vertices[3](d-1) * x_frac) +
4486  (patch->vertices[2](d-1) * (1-x_frac))) * y_frac) * (1-z_frac) +
4487  (((patch->vertices[5](d-1) * x_frac) +
4488  (patch->vertices[4](d-1) * (1-x_frac))) * (1-y_frac) +
4489  ((patch->vertices[7](d-1) * x_frac) +
4490  (patch->vertices[6](d-1) * (1-x_frac))) * y_frac) * z_frac)
4491  );
4492  entry++;
4493  }
4494  break;
4495  }
4496 
4497  default:
4498  Assert (false, ExcNotImplemented());
4499  }
4500  }
4501  }
4502 
4503 
4505  // data output.
4506  //
4507  reorder_task.join ();
4508 
4509  // then write data.
4510  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
4511  for (unsigned int entry=0; entry<data_vectors[data_set].size(); entry++)
4512  tm.nd((spacedim+data_set),entry) = static_cast<float>(data_vectors[data_set][entry]);
4513 
4514 
4515 
4516 
4518  // now for the cells. note that
4519  // vertices are counted from 1 onwards
4520  unsigned int first_vertex_of_patch = 0;
4521  unsigned int elem=0;
4522 
4523  for (typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch=patches.begin();
4524  patch!=patches.end(); ++patch)
4525  {
4526  const unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
4527  const unsigned int n = n_subdivisions+1;
4528  const unsigned int d1=1;
4529  const unsigned int d2=n;
4530  const unsigned int d3=n*n;
4531  // write out the cells making
4532  // up this patch
4533  switch (dim)
4534  {
4535  case 2:
4536  {
4537  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n_subdivisions; ++i2)
4538  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n_subdivisions; ++i1)
4539  {
4540  tm.cd(0,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1 )*d1+(i2 )*d2+1;
4541  tm.cd(1,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1+1)*d1+(i2 )*d2+1;
4542  tm.cd(2,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1+1)*d1+(i2+1)*d2+1;
4543  tm.cd(3,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1 )*d1+(i2+1)*d2+1;
4544 
4545  elem++;
4546  }
4547  break;
4548  }
4549 
4550  case 3:
4551  {
4552  for (unsigned int i3=0; i3<n_subdivisions; ++i3)
4553  for (unsigned int i2=0; i2<n_subdivisions; ++i2)
4554  for (unsigned int i1=0; i1<n_subdivisions; ++i1)
4555  {
4556  // note: vertex indices start with 1!
4557 
4558 
4559  tm.cd(0,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1 )*d1+(i2 )*d2+(i3 )*d3+1;
4560  tm.cd(1,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1+1)*d1+(i2 )*d2+(i3 )*d3+1;
4561  tm.cd(2,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1+1)*d1+(i2+1)*d2+(i3 )*d3+1;
4562  tm.cd(3,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1 )*d1+(i2+1)*d2+(i3 )*d3+1;
4563  tm.cd(4,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1 )*d1+(i2 )*d2+(i3+1)*d3+1;
4564  tm.cd(5,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1+1)*d1+(i2 )*d2+(i3+1)*d3+1;
4565  tm.cd(6,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1+1)*d1+(i2+1)*d2+(i3+1)*d3+1;
4566  tm.cd(7,elem) = first_vertex_of_patch+(i1 )*d1+(i2+1)*d2+(i3+1)*d3+1;
4567 
4568  elem++;
4569  }
4570  break;
4571  }
4572 
4573  default:
4574  Assert (false, ExcNotImplemented());
4575  }
4576 
4577 
4578  // finally update the number
4579  // of the first vertex of this patch
4580  first_vertex_of_patch += Utilities::fixed_power<dim>(n);
4581  }
4582 
4583 
4584  {
4585  int ierr = 0,
4586  num_nodes = static_cast<int>(n_nodes),
4587  num_cells = static_cast<int>(n_cells);
4588 
4589  char dot[2] = {'.', 0};
4590  // Unfortunately, TECINI takes a
4591  // char *, but c_str() gives a
4592  // const char *. As we don't do
4593  // anything else with
4594  // tec_var_names following
4595  // const_cast is ok
4596  char *var_names=const_cast<char *> (tec_var_names.c_str());
4597  ierr = TECINI (NULL,
4598  var_names,
4599  file_name,
4600  dot,
4601  &tec_debug,
4602  &is_double);
4603 
4604  Assert (ierr == 0, ExcErrorOpeningTecplotFile(file_name));
4605 
4606  char FEBLOCK[] = {'F','E','B','L','O','C','K',0};
4607  ierr = TECZNE (NULL,
4608  &num_nodes,
4609  &num_cells,
4610  &cell_type,
4611  FEBLOCK,
4612  NULL);
4613 
4614  Assert (ierr == 0, ExcTecplotAPIError());
4615 
4616  int total = (vars_per_node*num_nodes);
4617 
4618  ierr = TECDAT (&total,
4619  &tm.nodalData[0],
4620  &is_double);
4621 
4622  Assert (ierr == 0, ExcTecplotAPIError());
4623 
4624  ierr = TECNOD (&tm.connData[0]);
4625 
4626  Assert (ierr == 0, ExcTecplotAPIError());
4627 
4628  ierr = TECEND ();
4629 
4630  Assert (ierr == 0, ExcTecplotAPIError());
4631  }
4632 #endif
4633  }
4634 
4635 
4636 
4637  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4638  void
4639  write_vtk (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
4640  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
4641  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &vector_data_ranges,
4642  const VtkFlags &flags,
4643  std::ostream &out)
4644  {
4645  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4646 
4647 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
4648  // verify that there are indeed
4649  // patches to be written out. most
4650  // of the times, people just forget
4651  // to call build_patches when there
4652  // are no patches, so a warning is
4653  // in order. that said, the
4654  // assertion is disabled if we
4655  // support MPI since then it can
4656  // happen that on the coarsest
4657  // mesh, a processor simply has no
4658  // cells it actually owns, and in
4659  // that case it is legit if there
4660  // are no patches
4661  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
4662 #else
4663  if (patches.size() == 0)
4664  return;
4665 #endif
4666 
4667  VtkStream vtk_out(out, flags);
4668 
4669  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
4670  // check against # of data sets in
4671  // first patch.
4672  if (patches[0].points_are_available)
4673  {
4674  AssertDimension(n_data_sets + spacedim, patches[0].data.n_rows())
4675  }
4676  else
4677  {
4678  AssertDimension(n_data_sets, patches[0].data.n_rows())
4679  }
4680 
4682  // preamble
4683  {
4684  out << "# vtk DataFile Version 3.0"
4685  << '\n'
4686  << "#This file was generated by the deal.II library";
4687  if (flags.print_date_and_time)
4688  {
4689  out << " on " << Utilities::System::get_date()
4690  << " at " << Utilities::System::get_time();
4691  }
4692  else
4693  out << ".";
4694  out << '\n'
4695  << "ASCII"
4696  << '\n';
4697  // now output the data header
4698  out << "DATASET UNSTRUCTURED_GRID\n"
4699  << '\n';
4700  }
4701 
4702  // if desired, output time and cycle of the simulation, following
4703  // the instructions at
4704  // http://www.visitusers.org/index.php?title=Time_and_Cycle_in_VTK_files
4705  {
4706  const unsigned int
4707  n_metadata = ((flags.cycle != std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::min() ? 1 : 0)
4708  +
4709  (flags.time != std::numeric_limits<double>::min() ? 1 : 0));
4710  if (n_metadata > 0)
4711  out << "FIELD FieldData " << n_metadata << "\n";
4712 
4713  if (flags.cycle != std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::min())
4714  {
4715  out << "CYCLE 1 1 int\n"
4716  << flags.cycle << "\n";
4717  }
4718  if (flags.time != std::numeric_limits<double>::min())
4719  {
4720  out << "TIME 1 1 double\n"
4721  << flags.time << "\n";
4722  }
4723  }
4724 
4725  // first count the number of cells
4726  // and cells for later use
4727  unsigned int n_nodes;
4728  unsigned int n_cells;
4729  compute_sizes<dim,spacedim>(patches, n_nodes, n_cells);
4730  // in gmv format the vertex
4731  // coordinates and the data have an
4732  // order that is a bit unpleasant
4733  // (first all x coordinates, then
4734  // all y coordinate, ...; first all
4735  // data of variable 1, then
4736  // variable 2, etc), so we have to
4737  // copy the data vectors a bit around
4738  //
4739  // note that we copy vectors when
4740  // looping over the patches since we
4741  // have to write them one variable
4742  // at a time and don't want to use
4743  // more than one loop
4744  //
4745  // this copying of data vectors can
4746  // be done while we already output
4747  // the vertices, so do this on a
4748  // separate task and when wanting
4749  // to write out the data, we wait
4750  // for that task to finish
4751  Table<2,double> data_vectors (n_data_sets, n_nodes);
4752 
4753  void (*fun_ptr) (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &,
4754  Table<2,double> &)
4755  = &write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors<dim,spacedim>;
4756  Threads::Task<> reorder_task = Threads::new_task (fun_ptr, patches, data_vectors);
4757 
4759  // first make up a list of used
4760  // vertices along with their
4761  // coordinates
4762  //
4763  // note that we have to print
4764  // d=1..3 dimensions
4765  out << "POINTS " << n_nodes << " double" << '\n';
4766  write_nodes(patches, vtk_out);
4767  out << '\n';
4769  // now for the cells
4770  out << "CELLS " << n_cells << ' '
4771  << n_cells*(GeometryInfo<dim>::vertices_per_cell+1)
4772  << '\n';
4773  write_cells(patches, vtk_out);
4774  out << '\n';
4775  // next output the types of the
4776  // cells. since all cells are
4777  // the same, this is simple
4778  out << "CELL_TYPES " << n_cells << '\n';
4779  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_cells; ++i)
4780  out << ' ' << vtk_cell_type[dim];
4781  out << '\n';
4783  // data output.
4784 
4785  // now write the data vectors to
4786  // @p{out} first make sure that all
4787  // data is in place
4788  reorder_task.join ();
4789 
4790  // then write data. the
4791  // 'POINT_DATA' means: node data
4792  // (as opposed to cell data, which
4793  // we do not support explicitly
4794  // here). all following data sets
4795  // are point data
4796  out << "POINT_DATA " << n_nodes
4797  << '\n';
4798 
4799  // when writing, first write out
4800  // all vector data, then handle the
4801  // scalar data sets that have been
4802  // left over
4803  std::vector<bool> data_set_written (n_data_sets, false);
4804  for (unsigned int n_th_vector=0; n_th_vector<vector_data_ranges.size(); ++n_th_vector)
4805  {
4806  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) >=
4807  std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
4808  ExcLowerRange (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
4809  std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])));
4810  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) < n_data_sets,
4811  ExcIndexRange (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
4812  0, n_data_sets));
4813  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) + 1
4814  - std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) <= 3,
4815  ExcMessage ("Can't declare a vector with more than 3 components "
4816  "in VTK"));
4817 
4818  // mark these components as already written:
4819  for (unsigned int i=std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
4820  i<=std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
4821  ++i)
4822  data_set_written[i] = true;
4823 
4824  // write the
4825  // header. concatenate all the
4826  // component names with double
4827  // underscores unless a vector
4828  // name has been specified
4829  out << "VECTORS ";
4830 
4831  if (std::get<2>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) != "")
4832  out << std::get<2>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
4833  else
4834  {
4835  for (unsigned int i=std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
4836  i<std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
4837  ++i)
4838  out << data_names[i] << "__";
4839  out << data_names[std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])];
4840  }
4841 
4842  out << " double"
4843  << '\n';
4844 
4845  // now write data. pad all
4846  // vectors to have three
4847  // components
4848  for (unsigned int n=0; n<n_nodes; ++n)
4849  {
4850  switch (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) -
4851  std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]))
4852  {
4853  case 0:
4854  out << data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]), n) << " 0 0"
4855  << '\n';
4856  break;
4857 
4858  case 1:
4859  out << data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]), n) << ' '<< data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])+1, n) << " 0"
4860  << '\n';
4861  break;
4862  case 2:
4863  out << data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]), n) << ' '<< data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])+1, n) << ' '<< data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])+2, n)
4864  << '\n';
4865  break;
4866 
4867  default:
4868  // VTK doesn't
4869  // support
4870  // anything else
4871  // than vectors
4872  // with 1, 2, or
4873  // 3 components
4874  Assert (false, ExcInternalError());
4875  }
4876  }
4877  }
4878 
4879  // now do the left over scalar data sets
4880  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
4881  if (data_set_written[data_set] == false)
4882  {
4883  out << "SCALARS "
4884  << data_names[data_set]
4885  << " double 1"
4886  << '\n'
4887  << "LOOKUP_TABLE default"
4888  << '\n';
4889  std::copy (data_vectors[data_set].begin(),
4890  data_vectors[data_set].end(),
4891  std::ostream_iterator<double>(out, " "));
4892  out << '\n';
4893  }
4894 
4895  // make sure everything now gets to
4896  // disk
4897  out.flush ();
4898 
4899  // assert the stream is still ok
4900  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4901  }
4902 
4903 
4904  void write_vtu_header (std::ostream &out,
4905  const VtkFlags &flags)
4906  {
4907  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4908  out << "<?xml version=\"1.0\" ?> \n";
4909  out << "<!-- \n";
4910  out << "# vtk DataFile Version 3.0"
4911  << '\n'
4912  << "#This file was generated by the deal.II library";
4913  if (flags.print_date_and_time)
4914  {
4915  out << " on " << Utilities::System::get_time()
4916  << " at " << Utilities::System::get_date();
4917  }
4918  else
4919  out << ".";
4920  out << "\n-->\n";
4921  out << "<VTKFile type=\"UnstructuredGrid\" version=\"0.1\"";
4922 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB
4923  out << " compressor=\"vtkZLibDataCompressor\"";
4924 #endif
4925 #ifdef DEAL_II_WORDS_BIGENDIAN
4926  out << " byte_order=\"BigEndian\"";
4927 #else
4928  out << " byte_order=\"LittleEndian\"";
4929 #endif
4930  out << ">";
4931  out << '\n';
4932  out << "<UnstructuredGrid>";
4933  out << '\n';
4934  }
4935 
4936 
4937 
4938  void write_vtu_footer (std::ostream &out)
4939  {
4940  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4941  out << " </UnstructuredGrid>\n";
4942  out << "</VTKFile>\n";
4943  }
4944 
4945 
4946 
4947  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4948  void
4949  write_vtu (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
4950  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
4951  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &vector_data_ranges,
4952  const VtkFlags &flags,
4953  std::ostream &out)
4954  {
4955  write_vtu_header(out, flags);
4956  write_vtu_main (patches, data_names, vector_data_ranges, flags, out);
4957  write_vtu_footer(out);
4958 
4959  out << std::flush;
4960  }
4961 
4962 
4963  template <int dim, int spacedim>
4964  void write_vtu_main (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &patches,
4965  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
4966  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &vector_data_ranges,
4967  const VtkFlags &flags,
4968  std::ostream &out)
4969  {
4970  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
4971 
4972 #ifndef DEAL_II_WITH_MPI
4973  // verify that there are indeed
4974  // patches to be written out. most
4975  // of the times, people just forget
4976  // to call build_patches when there
4977  // are no patches, so a warning is
4978  // in order. that said, the
4979  // assertion is disabled if we
4980  // support MPI since then it can
4981  // happen that on the coarsest
4982  // mesh, a processor simply has no
4983  // cells it actually owns, and in
4984  // that case it is legit if there
4985  // are no patches
4986  Assert (patches.size() > 0, ExcNoPatches());
4987 #else
4988  if (patches.size() == 0)
4989  {
4990  // we still need to output a valid vtu file, because other CPUs
4991  // might output data. This is the minimal file that is accepted by paraview and visit.
4992  // if we remove the field definitions, visit is complaining.
4993  out << "<Piece NumberOfPoints=\"0\" NumberOfCells=\"0\" >\n"
4994  << "<Cells>\n"
4995  << "<DataArray type=\"UInt8\" Name=\"types\"></DataArray>\n"
4996  << "</Cells>\n"
4997  << " <PointData Scalars=\"scalars\">\n";
4998  std::vector<bool> data_set_written (data_names.size(), false);
4999  for (unsigned int n_th_vector=0; n_th_vector<vector_data_ranges.size(); ++n_th_vector)
5000  {
5001  // mark these components as already
5002  // written:
5003  for (unsigned int i=std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5004  i<=std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5005  ++i)
5006  data_set_written[i] = true;
5007 
5008  // write the
5009  // header. concatenate all the
5010  // component names with double
5011  // underscores unless a vector
5012  // name has been specified
5013  out << " <DataArray type=\"Float64\" Name=\"";
5014 
5015  if (std::get<2>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) != "")
5016  out << std::get<2>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5017  else
5018  {
5019  for (unsigned int i=std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5020  i<std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5021  ++i)
5022  out << data_names[i] << "__";
5023  out << data_names[std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])];
5024  }
5025 
5026  out << "\" NumberOfComponents=\"3\"></DataArray>\n";
5027  }
5028 
5029  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<data_names.size(); ++data_set)
5030  if (data_set_written[data_set] == false)
5031  {
5032  out << " <DataArray type=\"Float64\" Name=\""
5033  << data_names[data_set]
5034  << "\"></DataArray>\n";
5035  }
5036 
5037  out << " </PointData>\n";
5038  out << "</Piece>\n";
5039 
5040  out << std::flush;
5041 
5042  return;
5043  }
5044 #endif
5045 
5046  // first up: metadata
5047  //
5048  // if desired, output time and cycle of the simulation, following
5049  // the instructions at
5050  // http://www.visitusers.org/index.php?title=Time_and_Cycle_in_VTK_files
5051  {
5052  const unsigned int
5053  n_metadata = ((flags.cycle != std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::min() ? 1 : 0)
5054  +
5055  (flags.time != std::numeric_limits<double>::min() ? 1 : 0));
5056  if (n_metadata > 0)
5057  out << "<FieldData>\n";
5058 
5059  if (flags.cycle != std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::min())
5060  {
5061  out << "<DataArray type=\"Float32\" Name=\"CYCLE\" NumberOfTuples=\"1\" format=\"ascii\">"
5062  << flags.cycle
5063  << "</DataArray>\n";
5064  }
5065  if (flags.time != std::numeric_limits<double>::min())
5066  {
5067  out << "<DataArray type=\"Float32\" Name=\"TIME\" NumberOfTuples=\"1\" format=\"ascii\">"
5068  << flags.time
5069  << "</DataArray>\n";
5070  }
5071 
5072  if (n_metadata > 0)
5073  out << "</FieldData>\n";
5074  }
5075 
5076 
5077  VtuStream vtu_out(out, flags);
5078 
5079  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
5080  // check against # of data sets in
5081  // first patch. checks against all
5082  // other patches are made in
5083  // write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors
5084  if (patches[0].points_are_available)
5085  {
5086  AssertDimension(n_data_sets + spacedim, patches[0].data.n_rows())
5087  }
5088  else
5089  {
5090  AssertDimension(n_data_sets, patches[0].data.n_rows())
5091  }
5092 
5093 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB
5094  const char *ascii_or_binary = "binary";
5095 #else
5096  const char *ascii_or_binary = "ascii";
5097 #endif
5098 
5099 
5100  // first count the number of cells
5101  // and cells for later use
5102  unsigned int n_nodes;
5103  unsigned int n_cells;
5104  compute_sizes<dim,spacedim>(patches, n_nodes, n_cells);
5105  // in gmv format the vertex
5106  // coordinates and the data have an
5107  // order that is a bit unpleasant
5108  // (first all x coordinates, then
5109  // all y coordinate, ...; first all
5110  // data of variable 1, then
5111  // variable 2, etc), so we have to
5112  // copy the data vectors a bit around
5113  //
5114  // note that we copy vectors when
5115  // looping over the patches since we
5116  // have to write them one variable
5117  // at a time and don't want to use
5118  // more than one loop
5119  //
5120  // this copying of data vectors can
5121  // be done while we already output
5122  // the vertices, so do this on a
5123  // separate task and when wanting
5124  // to write out the data, we wait
5125  // for that task to finish
5126  Table<2,double> data_vectors (n_data_sets, n_nodes);
5127 
5128  void (*fun_ptr) (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &,
5129  Table<2,double> &)
5130  = &write_gmv_reorder_data_vectors<dim,spacedim>;
5131  Threads::Task<> reorder_task = Threads::new_task (fun_ptr, patches,
5132  data_vectors);
5133 
5135  // first make up a list of used
5136  // vertices along with their
5137  // coordinates
5138  //
5139  // note that according to the standard, we
5140  // have to print d=1..3 dimensions, even if
5141  // we are in reality in 2d, for example
5142  out << "<Piece NumberOfPoints=\"" << n_nodes
5143  <<"\" NumberOfCells=\"" << n_cells << "\" >\n";
5144  out << " <Points>\n";
5145  out << " <DataArray type=\"Float64\" NumberOfComponents=\"3\" format=\""
5146  << ascii_or_binary << "\">\n";
5147  write_nodes(patches, vtu_out);
5148  out << " </DataArray>\n";
5149  out << " </Points>\n\n";
5151  // now for the cells
5152  out << " <Cells>\n";
5153  out << " <DataArray type=\"Int32\" Name=\"connectivity\" format=\""
5154  << ascii_or_binary << "\">\n";
5155  write_cells(patches, vtu_out);
5156  out << " </DataArray>\n";
5157 
5158  // XML VTU format uses offsets; this is
5159  // different than the VTK format, which
5160  // puts the number of nodes per cell in
5161  // front of the connectivity list.
5162  out << " <DataArray type=\"Int32\" Name=\"offsets\" format=\""
5163  << ascii_or_binary << "\">\n";
5164 
5165  std::vector<int32_t> offsets (n_cells);
5166  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_cells; ++i)
5167  offsets[i] = (i+1)*GeometryInfo<dim>::vertices_per_cell;
5168  vtu_out << offsets;
5169  out << "\n";
5170  out << " </DataArray>\n";
5171 
5172  // next output the types of the
5173  // cells. since all cells are
5174  // the same, this is simple
5175  out << " <DataArray type=\"UInt8\" Name=\"types\" format=\""
5176  << ascii_or_binary << "\">\n";
5177 
5178  {
5179  // uint8_t might be a typedef to unsigned
5180  // char which is then not printed as
5181  // ascii integers
5182 #ifdef DEAL_II_WITH_ZLIB
5183  std::vector<uint8_t> cell_types (n_cells,
5184  static_cast<uint8_t>(vtk_cell_type[dim]));
5185 #else
5186  std::vector<unsigned int> cell_types (n_cells,
5187  vtk_cell_type[dim]);
5188 #endif
5189  // this should compress well :-)
5190  vtu_out << cell_types;
5191  }
5192  out << "\n";
5193  out << " </DataArray>\n";
5194  out << " </Cells>\n";
5195 
5196 
5198  // data output.
5199 
5200  // now write the data vectors to
5201  // @p{out} first make sure that all
5202  // data is in place
5203  reorder_task.join ();
5204 
5205  // then write data. the
5206  // 'POINT_DATA' means: node data
5207  // (as opposed to cell data, which
5208  // we do not support explicitly
5209  // here). all following data sets
5210  // are point data
5211  out << " <PointData Scalars=\"scalars\">\n";
5212 
5213  // when writing, first write out
5214  // all vector data, then handle the
5215  // scalar data sets that have been
5216  // left over
5217  std::vector<bool> data_set_written (n_data_sets, false);
5218  for (unsigned int n_th_vector=0; n_th_vector<vector_data_ranges.size(); ++n_th_vector)
5219  {
5220  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) >=
5221  std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
5222  ExcLowerRange (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
5223  std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])));
5224  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) < n_data_sets,
5225  ExcIndexRange (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
5226  0, n_data_sets));
5227  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) + 1
5228  - std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) <= 3,
5229  ExcMessage ("Can't declare a vector with more than 3 components "
5230  "in VTK"));
5231 
5232  // mark these components as already
5233  // written:
5234  for (unsigned int i=std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5235  i<=std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5236  ++i)
5237  data_set_written[i] = true;
5238 
5239  // write the
5240  // header. concatenate all the
5241  // component names with double
5242  // underscores unless a vector
5243  // name has been specified
5244  out << " <DataArray type=\"Float64\" Name=\"";
5245 
5246  if (std::get<2>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) != "")
5247  out << std::get<2>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5248  else
5249  {
5250  for (unsigned int i=std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5251  i<std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5252  ++i)
5253  out << data_names[i] << "__";
5254  out << data_names[std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])];
5255  }
5256 
5257  out << "\" NumberOfComponents=\"3\" format=\""
5258  << ascii_or_binary << "\">\n";
5259 
5260  // now write data. pad all
5261  // vectors to have three
5262  // components
5263  std::vector<double> data;
5264  data.reserve (n_nodes*dim);
5265 
5266  for (unsigned int n=0; n<n_nodes; ++n)
5267  {
5268  switch (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) -
5269  std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]))
5270  {
5271  case 0:
5272  data.push_back (data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]), n));
5273  data.push_back (0);
5274  data.push_back (0);
5275  break;
5276 
5277  case 1:
5278  data.push_back (data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]), n));
5279  data.push_back (data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])+1, n));
5280  data.push_back (0);
5281  break;
5282  case 2:
5283  data.push_back (data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]), n));
5284  data.push_back (data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])+1, n));
5285  data.push_back (data_vectors(std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])+2, n));
5286  break;
5287 
5288  default:
5289  // VTK doesn't
5290  // support
5291  // anything else
5292  // than vectors
5293  // with 1, 2, or
5294  // 3 components
5295  Assert (false, ExcInternalError());
5296  }
5297  }
5298  vtu_out << data;
5299  out << " </DataArray>\n";
5300  }
5301 
5302  // now do the left over scalar data sets
5303  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
5304  if (data_set_written[data_set] == false)
5305  {
5306  out << " <DataArray type=\"Float64\" Name=\""
5307  << data_names[data_set]
5308  << "\" format=\""
5309  << ascii_or_binary << "\">\n";
5310 
5311  std::vector<double> data (data_vectors[data_set].begin(),
5312  data_vectors[data_set].end());
5313  vtu_out << data;
5314  out << " </DataArray>\n";
5315  }
5316 
5317  out << " </PointData>\n";
5318 
5319  // Finish up writing a valid XML file
5320  out << " </Piece>\n";
5321 
5322  // make sure everything now gets to
5323  // disk
5324  out.flush ();
5325 
5326  // assert the stream is still ok
5327  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
5328  }
5329 
5330 
5331 
5332  void
5333  write_pvtu_record (std::ostream &out,
5334  const std::vector<std::string> &piece_names,
5335  const std::vector<std::string> &data_names,
5336  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &vector_data_ranges)
5337  {
5338  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
5339 
5340  const unsigned int n_data_sets = data_names.size();
5341 
5342  out << "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\n";
5343 
5344  out << "<!--\n";
5345  out << "#This file was generated by the deal.II library"
5346  << " on " << Utilities::System::get_date()
5347  << " at " << Utilities::System::get_time()
5348  << "\n-->\n";
5349 
5350  out << "<VTKFile type=\"PUnstructuredGrid\" version=\"0.1\" byte_order=\"LittleEndian\">\n";
5351  out << " <PUnstructuredGrid GhostLevel=\"0\">\n";
5352  out << " <PPointData Scalars=\"scalars\">\n";
5353 
5354  // We need to output in the same order as
5355  // the write_vtu function does:
5356  std::vector<bool> data_set_written (n_data_sets, false);
5357  for (unsigned int n_th_vector=0; n_th_vector<vector_data_ranges.size(); ++n_th_vector)
5358  {
5359  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) >=
5360  std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
5361  ExcLowerRange (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
5362  std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])));
5363  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) < n_data_sets,
5364  ExcIndexRange (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]),
5365  0, n_data_sets));
5366  AssertThrow (std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) + 1
5367  - std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) <= 3,
5368  ExcMessage ("Can't declare a vector with more than 3 components "
5369  "in VTK"));
5370 
5371  // mark these components as already
5372  // written:
5373  for (unsigned int i=std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5374  i<=std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5375  ++i)
5376  data_set_written[i] = true;
5377 
5378  // write the
5379  // header. concatenate all the
5380  // component names with double
5381  // underscores unless a vector
5382  // name has been specified
5383  out << " <PDataArray type=\"Float64\" Name=\"";
5384 
5385  if (std::get<2>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]) != "")
5386  out << std::get<2>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5387  else
5388  {
5389  for (unsigned int i=std::get<0>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5390  i<std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector]);
5391  ++i)
5392  out << data_names[i] << "__";
5393  out << data_names[std::get<1>(vector_data_ranges[n_th_vector])];
5394  }
5395 
5396  out << "\" NumberOfComponents=\"3\" format=\"ascii\"/>\n";
5397  }
5398 
5399  for (unsigned int data_set=0; data_set<n_data_sets; ++data_set)
5400  if (data_set_written[data_set] == false)
5401  {
5402  out << " <PDataArray type=\"Float64\" Name=\""
5403  << data_names[data_set]
5404  << "\" format=\"ascii\"/>\n";
5405  }
5406 
5407  out << " </PPointData>\n";
5408 
5409  out << " <PPoints>\n";
5410  out << " <PDataArray type=\"Float64\" NumberOfComponents=\"3\"/>\n";
5411  out << " </PPoints>\n";
5412 
5413  for (unsigned int i=0; i<piece_names.size(); ++i)
5414  out << " <Piece Source=\"" << piece_names[i] << "\"/>\n";
5415 
5416  out << " </PUnstructuredGrid>\n";
5417  out << "</VTKFile>\n";
5418 
5419  out.flush();
5420 
5421  // assert the stream is still ok
5422  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
5423  }
5424 
5425 
5426 
5427  void
5428  write_pvd_record (std::ostream &out,
5429  const std::vector<std::pair<double,std::string> > &times_and_names)
5430  {
5431  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
5432 
5433  out << "<?xml version=\"1.0\"?>\n";
5434 
5435  out << "<!--\n";
5436  out << "#This file was generated by the deal.II library"
5437  << " on " << Utilities::System::get_date()
5438  << " at " << Utilities::System::get_time()
5439  << "\n-->\n";
5440 
5441  out << "<VTKFile type=\"Collection\" version=\"0.1\" ByteOrder=\"LittleEndian\">\n";
5442  out << " <Collection>\n";
5443 
5444  std::streamsize ss = out.precision();
5445  out.precision(12);
5446 
5447  for (unsigned int i=0; i<times_and_names.size(); ++i)
5448  out << " <DataSet timestep=\"" << times_and_names[i].first
5449  << "\" group=\"\" part=\"0\" file=\"" << times_and_names[i].second
5450  << "\"/>\n";
5451 
5452  out << " </Collection>\n";
5453  out << "</VTKFile>\n";
5454 
5455  out.flush();
5456  out.precision(ss);
5457 
5458  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
5459  }
5460 
5461 
5462 
5463  void
5464  write_visit_record (std::ostream &out,
5465  const std::vector<std::string> &piece_names)
5466  {
5467  out << "!NBLOCKS " << piece_names.size() << '\n';
5468  for (unsigned int i=0; i<piece_names.size(); ++i)
5469  out << piece_names[i] << '\n';
5470 
5471  out << std::flush;
5472  }
5473 
5474 
5475 
5476  void
5477  write_visit_record (std::ostream &out,
5478  const std::vector<std::vector<std::string> > &piece_names)
5479  {
5480  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
5481 
5482  if (piece_names.size() == 0)
5483  return;
5484 
5485  const double nblocks = piece_names[0].size();
5486  Assert(nblocks > 0, ExcMessage("piece_names should be a vector of nonempty vectors.") )
5487 
5488  out << "!NBLOCKS " << nblocks << '\n';
5489  for (std::vector<std::vector<std::string> >::const_iterator domain = piece_names.begin(); domain != piece_names.end(); ++domain)
5490  {
5491  Assert(domain->size() == nblocks, ExcMessage("piece_names should be a vector of equal sized vectors.") )
5492  for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator subdomain = domain->begin(); subdomain != domain->end(); ++subdomain)
5493  out << *subdomain << '\n';
5494  }
5495 
5496  out << std::flush;
5497  }
5498 
5499 
5500 
5501  void
5502  write_visit_record (std::ostream &out,
5503  const std::vector<std::pair<double,std::vector<std::string> > > &times_and_piece_names)
5504  {
5505  AssertThrow (out, ExcIO());
5506 
5507  if (times_and_piece_names.size() == 0)
5508  return;
5509 
5510  const double nblocks = times_and_piece_names[0].second.size();
5511  Assert(nblocks > 0, ExcMessage("time_and_piece_names should contain nonempty vectors of filenames for every timestep.") )
5512 
5513  for (std::vector<std::pair<double,std::vector<std::string> > >::const_iterator domain = times_and_piece_names.begin();
5514  domain != times_and_piece_names.end(); ++domain)
5515  out << "!TIME " << domain->first << '\n';
5516 
5517  out << "!NBLOCKS " << nblocks << '\n';
5518  for (std::vector<std::pair<double,std::vector<std::string> > >::const_iterator domain = times_and_piece_names.begin();
5519  domain != times_and_piece_names.end(); ++domain)
5520  {
5521  Assert(domain->second.size() == nblocks, ExcMessage("piece_names should be a vector of equal sized vectors.") )
5522  for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator subdomain = domain->second.begin(); subdomain != domain->second.end(); ++subdomain)
5523  out << *subdomain << '\n';
5524  }
5525 
5526  out << std::flush;
5527  }
5528 
5529 
5530 
5531  template <int dim, int spacedim>
5532  void write_svg (const std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> > &,
5533  const std::vector<std::string> &,
5534  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &,
5535  const SvgFlags &,
5536  std::ostream &)
5537  {
5538  Assert (false, ExcNotImplemented());
5539  }
5540 
5541  template <int spacedim>
5542  void write_svg (const std::vector<Patch<2,spacedim> > &patches,
5543  const std::vector<std::string> &/*data_names*/,
5544  const std::vector<std::tuple<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::string> > &/*vector_data_ranges*/,
5545  const SvgFlags &flags,
5546  std::ostream &out)
5547  {
5548  const int dim = 2;
5549  const unsigned int height = flags.height;
5550  unsigned int width = flags.width;
5551 
5552  // margin around the plotted area
5553  unsigned int margin_in_percent = 0;
5554  if (flags.margin) margin_in_percent = 5;
5555 
5556 
5557  // determine the bounding box in the model space
5558  double x_dimension, y_dimension, z_dimension;
5559 
5560  typename std::vector<Patch<dim,spacedim> >::const_iterator patch = patches.begin();
5561 
5562  unsigned int n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
5563  unsigned int n = n_subdivisions + 1;
5564  const unsigned int d1 = 1;
5565  const unsigned int d2 = n;
5566 
5567  Point<spacedim> projected_point;
5568  Point<spacedim> projected_points[4];
5569 
5570  Point<2> projection_decomposition;
5571  Point<2> projection_decompositions[4];
5572 
5573  compute_node(projected_point, &*patch, 0, 0, 0, n_subdivisions);
5574 
5575  Assert ((flags.height_vector < patch->data.n_rows()) ||
5576  patch->data.n_rows() == 0,
5577  ExcIndexRange (flags.height_vector, 0, patch->data.n_rows()));
5578 
5579  double x_min = projected_point[0];
5580  double x_max = x_min;
5581  double y_min = projected_point[1];
5582  double y_max = y_min;
5583  double z_min = patch->data.n_rows() != 0 ? patch->data(flags.height_vector,0) : 0;
5584  double z_max = z_min;
5585 
5586  // iterate over the patches
5587  for (; patch != patches.end(); ++patch)
5588  {
5589  n_subdivisions = patch->n_subdivisions;
5590  n = n_subdivisions + 1;
5591 
5592  for (unsigned int i2 = 0; i2 < n_subdivisions; ++i2)
5593  {
5594  for (unsigned int i1 = 0; i1 < n_subdivisions; ++i1)
5595  {
5596  compute_node(projected_points[0], &*patch, i1, i2, 0, n_subdivisions);
5597  compute_node(projected_points[1], &*patch, i1+1, i2, 0, n_subdivisions);
5598  compute_node(projected_points[2], &*patch, i1, i2+1, 0, n_subdivisions);
5599  compute_node(projected_points[3], &*patch, i1+1, i2+1, 0, n_subdivisions);
5600 
5601  x_min = std::min(x_min, (double)projected_points[0][0]);
5602  x_min = std::min(x_min, (double)projected_points[1][0]);
5603  x_min = std::min(x_min, (double)projected_points[2][0]);
5604  x_min = std::min(x_min, (double)projected_points[3][0]);
5605 
5606  x_max = std::max(x_max, (double)projected_points[0][0]);
5607  x_max = std::max(x_max, (double)projected_points[1][0]);
5608  x_max = std::max(x_max, (double)projected_points[2][0]);
5609  x_max = std::max(x_max, (double)projected_points[3][0]);
5610 
5611  y_min = std::min(y_min, (double)projected_points[0][1]);
5612  y_min = std::min(y_min, (double)projected_points[1][1]);
5613  y_min = std::min(y_min, (double)projected_points[2][1]);
5614  y_min = std::min(y_min, (double)projected_points[3][1]);
5615 
5616  y_max = std::max(y_max, (double)projected_points[0][1]);
5617  y_max = std::max(y_max, (double)projected_points[1][1]);
5618  y_max = std::max(y_max, (double)projected_points[2][1]);
5619  y_max = std::max(y_max, (double)projected_points[3][1]);
5620 
5621  Assert ((flags.height_vector < patch->data.n_rows()) ||
5622  patch->data.n_rows() == 0,
5623  ExcIndexRange (flags.height_vector, 0, patch->data.n_rows()));
5624 
5625  z_min = std::min(z_min, (double)patch->data(flags.height_vector, i1*d1 + i2*d2));
5626  z_min = std::min(z_min, (double)patch->data(flags.height_vector, (i1+1)*d1 + i2*d2));
5627  z_min = std::min(z_min, (double)patch->data(flags.height_vector, i1*d1 + (i2+1)*d2));
5628  z_min = std::min(z_min, (double)patch->data(flags.height_vector, (i1+1)*d1 + (i2+1)*d2));
5629 
5630  z_max = std::max(z_max, (double)patch->data(flags.height_vector, i1*d1 + i2*d2));
5631  z_max = std::max(z_max, (double)patch->data(flags.height_vector, (i1+1)*d1 + i2*d2));
5632  z_max = std::max(z_max, (double)patch->data(flags.height_vector, i1*d1 + (i2+1)*d2));
5633  z_max = std::max(z_max, (double)patch->data(flags.height_vector, (i1+1)*d1 + (i2+1)*d2));
5634  }
5635  }
5636  }
5637 
5638  x_dimension = x_max - x_min;
5639  y_dimension = y_max - y_min;
5640  z_dimension = z_max - z_min;
5641 
5642 
5643 // set initial camera position
5644  Point<3> camera_position;
5645  Point<3> camera_direction;
5646  Point<3> camera_horizontal;
5647  float camera_focus = 0;
5648 
5649  // translate camera from the origin to the initial position
5650  camera_position[0] = 0.;
5651  camera_position[1] = 0.;
5652  camera_position[2] = z_min + 2. * z_dimension;
5653 
5654  camera_direction[0] = 0.;
5655  camera_direction[1] = 0.;
5656  camera_direction[2] = - 1.;
5657 
5658  camera_horizontal[0] = 1.;
5659  camera_horizontal[1] = 0.;
5660  camera_horizontal[2] = 0.;
5661 
5662  camera_focus = .5 * z_dimension;
5663 
5664  Point<3> camera_position_temp;
5665  Point<3> camera_direction_temp;
5666  Point<3> camera_horizontal_temp;
5667 
5668  const float angle_factor = 3.14159265f / 180.f;
5669 
5670  // (I) rotate the camera to the chosen polar angle
5671  camera_position_temp[1] = cos(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_position[1] - sin(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_position[2];
5672  camera_position_temp[2] = sin(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_position[1] + cos(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_position[2];
5673 
5674  camera_direction_temp[1] = cos(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_direction[1] - sin(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_direction[2];
5675  camera_direction_temp[2] = sin(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_direction[1] + cos(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_direction[2];
5676 
5677  camera_horizontal_temp[1] = cos(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_horizontal[1] - sin(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_horizontal[2];
5678  camera_horizontal_temp[2] = sin(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_horizontal[1] + cos(angle_factor * flags.polar_angle) * camera_horizontal[2];
5679 
5680  camera_position[1] = camera_position_temp[1];
5681  camera_position[2] = camera_position_temp[2];
5682 
5683  camera_direction[1] = camera_direction_temp[1];
5684  camera_direction[2] = camera_direction_temp[2];
5685 
5686  camera_horizontal[1] = camera_horizontal_temp[1];
5687  camera_horizontal[2] = camera_horizontal_temp[2];
5688 
5689  // (II) rotate the camera to the chosen azimuth angle
5690  camera_position_temp[0] = cos(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_position[0] - sin(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_position[1];
5691  camera_position_temp[1] = sin(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_position[0] + cos(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_position[1];
5692 
5693  camera_direction_temp[0] = cos(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_direction[0] - sin(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_direction[1];
5694  camera_direction_temp[1] = sin(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_direction[0] + cos(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_direction[1];
5695 
5696  camera_horizontal_temp[0] = cos(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_horizontal[0] - sin(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_horizontal[1];
5697  camera_horizontal_temp[1] = sin(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_horizontal[0] + cos(angle_factor * flags.azimuth_angle) * camera_horizontal[1];
5698 
5699  camera_position[0] = camera_position_temp[0];
5700  camera_position[1] = camera_position_temp[1];
5701 
5702  camera_direction[0] = camera_direction_temp[0];
5703  camera_direction[1] = camera_direction_temp[1];
5704 
5705  camera_horizontal[0] = camera_horizontal_temp[0];
